campaign.story:
UPDATE: Thank you everyone, the campaign is now funded! But there's potentially more we can do: Essen? a podcast? live playthroughs? Check out the stretch goal section to see what we're going for next and comment in the update post to have a say in what the next one should be!
Hi everyone, I’m Tom. For the last two and a bit years, I’ve been making videos where I play through and talk about as many board games as I possibly can, and I'd love to keep doing that for another year! The channel is entirely independent, and funded by the viewers, and I need your help to keep it that way. Put plainly, the channel can't continue without funding. But if we're carrying on, it wouldn't hurt to add even more content, right?
You can find my channel at youtube.com/c/slickerdrips, and if you'd like to see the kind of videos I make, here's one of my playthrough playlists:
Or to get a quick list of the kind of games I love, here's my top 10 games of 2017:
I love making these videos. It's fantastic to be able to talk so much about the hobby I love, and at the same time I hope to give you an idea of how these games play all the way through. At the moment I'm coming up to 200 different games covered on the channel, and to give you some idea here's what the last year of videos looks like:
It was very tempting to keep going past the year mark to fill up that last row
And then on top of the playthroughs I make preview videos of games I'm interested in for conventions like Essen Spiel and the UK Games Expo, of which I also make the huge geeklist of games, appear on the Gaming Rules! podcast, try to spread the word about as many upcoming games as I can, and sometimes I do things like this which I can't really explain:
Last year I raised £2,500 in my first campaign, and thanks to this funding from the viewers, I was able to not just carry on but increase the number of videos in the last year. Now a bigger obstacle has emerged - time! For over two years now, I've been spending almost all of my evenings and weekends making these videos. Again, I love doing it, but at the same time there is no time to spare to take it any further, or even sustain it as it is now. That's where I'm hoping you come in.
The channel is completely independent, entirely funded by the viewers. I don't turn on YouTube ads and I've never accepted money from publishers to make any of the videos. I think this is an important thing to keep, and with your support I can keep making these videos independently. 
The money raised in this campaign will still absolutely contribute to the buying of games to keep featuring the latest and greatest games on the channel, but this time it will also give me the time I need to keep going - and after that, maybe we can talk about equipment, static cameras, podcasts, more Rachel?
Baked in to the funding goal of the channel are extra things I've been wanting to do but just haven't had the time to film like:
Games of the Week - this was a monthly show I did where I talked about all the new games I'd found out about that month, quickly talk about the new playthroughs, and anything else I'd stumbled across really. I'm always pleasantly surprised when someone asks me to bring this back, and honestly I never intended to stop doing it! 
Live monthly Q&As - I've dabbled in this when electronics haven't gotten the best of me, and now I want to make this a regular monthly thing where we can have a good old online get together 
Top 10 - I do them for conventions and at the end of the year, but I'd finally work out and film my thoughts on my top 10 favourite games! 
Collection videos - I have a lot of games in my collection that I keep around because they're so good, but they can only be filmed so fast! I'd make a series where I briefly talk about each of them, what they're like, and why we've kept them around 
T-Shirts! - okay, this one isn't about filming, but it's been Rachel's goal for quite a while now and we've finally made a t-shirt that we're both excited about! Scroll down to see more!
Anyway, if you contribute to the channel, it's only fair you get something in return so here is a selection of rewards:
This tier means you're happy without any rewards, but you do get my deepest gratitude and thanks - and thanks to a year of research the thanks will be 10% more thankful than we ever thought possible.
You've got the thanks, you're going home with them, they're safe, but if you pledge at this tier you'll also get to vote on some of the games I'll be filming! Every month a mixture of unfilmed games are put to the viewer vote, and you'll get to directly influence what ends up on the channel.
If one vote doesn't seem like enough votes, this could be the pledge level for you - this lets your voice be heard for TWO of the monthly game votes, and if my calculations are correct (and I believe they are) that's 24 votes! 
With the extra time to make videos, I'm adding another monthly vote and if you're at this level YOU get to participate in them too! That's three votes per month. I daren't do the maths on this one, but believe me when I say it should satisfy all but the votiest of voters. Anyone backing at this level or higher will also get the new channel microbadge on BoardGameGeek! 
You get everything from before, but as an extra thank you on top you'll also get this exclusive Kickstarter 38mm button badge! Marty's been busy in his spare time, and has been spending it this year becoming a sheriff in the wild wild west:
The slickest they is
Just like last year, the badge is drawn by my girlfriend Rachel and I'm incredibly thankful she did!
Absolutely everything from before, PLUS your name will go up in lights! Well, LED screen lights most likely - your name will be featured at the end of every video as a "producer" of the show! Again, I really want this to feature the names of the viewers that helped make the show happen, and not to advertise things.
Everything from the £30 tier, and your name will be featured at the very very end of the videos as an "Executive Producer" of the show, plus your powers as an Executive Producer give you a special vote to pick an unfilmed game from my collection to jump right to the top of the filming queue
Everything from the Executive Producer tier, with an extra special bonus. You'll be part of the inaugural Marty's Deputies! He won't be asking you to fight crime, he can handle that pretty well by himself, but he will be asking you to join this exclusive little club. Extra benefits include a private group where deputies can talk amongst themselves (and myself!), participate in the exclusive deputy fourth monthly vote (with options decided by the deputies too!), and receive an even more limited extra special, bigger Deputy badge:
Marty painstakingly handcrafts these badges which is extremely difficult with paws in general, let alone glass ones. That's why I've been asked to limit this to 7 Deputies, and I don't want to fight the law on this one.
This is what it's all about really! I've got some ideas I'm excited about, but just being able to carry on is the focus first. But then again, wouldn't it be lovely to talk about Essen Spiel? Live playthroughs? More Rachel appearances? A PODCAST?? There are more ideas and possibilities swimming around, but let's leave it there for now! A convention in the US of States? Static camera? Shh, I said leave it there for now!
Essen Spiel is the bustling hub of board games, and running backwards and forwards through the halls for days on end gives the channel the biggest boost of the most in demand games. So much so that all these months after the last Spiel I'm still filming some of them! Hitting this goal will mean I can go there again to bring back everything I can and then get to filming it all!
This year we've only gone and made a t-shirt! Show the world that Sheriff Marty is in charge:
And here's what it might look like in real life! (Rach really wanted to try a vest first but it wasn't quite right)
I didn't want to make a lot of extra tiers to put shirt options in there, but if you'd like the very first slickerdrips shirt, just visit this thread and see all the info!
Phew! Well, I think that's the campaign page everyone! If you read this far, thank you very much and I hope you'll join me on this journey!

Risks and challenges
I don't anticipate any problems with achieving the rate of videos I'm projecting. Of course illness or sudden commitments could cause a small break in the videos but I'd work hard to make up for any gaps. This happened last December for the first time and lasted a few weeks, but even with that the rate of videos went up in the second year.

The turnaround on the badges is quite quick, but there's always some risk in getting something made. What if the machine forgets how to make badges, for example?

There will be a bit of a delay with the microbadge as the creator of last year's is quite busy right now getting married (congratulations, Matteo!). Don't worry though, in a couple of months there'll be another tiny Marty picture ready for your profile.

For other rewards like names in the credits and voting rights, I'll be able to put these into play as soon as the campaign clears.

Hi everyone! All seems to be well with the Kickstarter so it's all ready to go forward - here's a quick update on what's next:
Playthroughs
In video news, the 200th playthrough just went up! Okay, The Castles of Burgundy: The Dice Game isn't as new as it used to be but I was saving it for symmetry. If anyone can cajole Stefan Feld into designing another version of the game to preserve what I'm ambitiously calling a tradition for 300, I'd appreciate it. Next up is Lowlands which should hit your....subscription feed? tomorrow - it's got a stamp of approval signed, sealed and delivered from Uwe Rosenberg himself on the box, so....actually, why am I hyping it up? campaign.story:
Blame Space is the intergalactic sequel to Game of Blame (Kickstarted 2016). If you only play games where everyone sings Kumbaya and no one throws tantrums, pretzels or furniture, please stop reading now!
Someone is going to take the blame for your mission going south, and that someone is going out the airlock! But who?
Not you!
You'll need to raise issues about your crewmates while burying your own guilty secrets. Exploit your duty privileges or even swap your job to sow confusion and avoid taking a one-way space-walk. Then you just need to find that one poor schmuck to take the rap…
Co-operation will only get you so far in Blame Space because you can't trust anyone until you're safely in a lifepod and off the ship.
Gang up on someone too soon and you could weaponize their hand, making them more powerful than you could possibly imagine. Throw a teammate in the Brig who isn't planning to sabotage the ship and you've basically given them a free ticket home.
Be on the lookout for crewmembers who are showing symptoms of the alien virus and get them quarantined asap. Ewww!
Maybe you'll get the opportunity to betray everyone. Will you take it?
PLAY

Each crewmember has a starting duty, which comes with both power and responsibility. Sgt. Ahmar can abuse his role as security officer and throw 'wrongdoers' in the Brig, while cunning diplomat Mitzi Sakura can discredit her rivals with deadly gossip. Acting commander Grey won't make many friends by switching out the roster but then neither will the slightly bonkers navigator if she activates the damaged hyperdrive, disrupting spacetime just to save her own derriere.
"This is no mere reskin of an already great game: Blame Space adds a real sense of claustrophobia and tension to the game. Timing your devious blame strategy becomes evermore important here with precious airlocks in a chaotic state of repair, the potential to spend your last hours stuck in the brig or quarantine, and oh yes, a mad ship's computer that might just kill you all. It's like a terrible HR meeting on the Nostromo. Great addition to the 'Blame' line."    cardandpixel
"Blame Space is a card game that will have you flipping tables and falling out with your friends as they bring paranoia and sneaky gameplay to the forefront. Here’s the gist: Someone on your spaceship has caused your mission to fail, but who betrayed the crew? You’ll need to be good at sussing out the fibbers, but also need a knack for burying your own dark secrets. One thing’s for sure – you can’t trust anyone until you’re safely secured in that life pod. Timing is everything, which makes Blame Space a tense and engaging game. You can approach it differently each time too: you may want to betray your crew or maybe, you want to focus on exposing your other players. It makes Blame Space both unpredictable and replayable."   PC GAMER Online

To keep your playing area ship-shape, you can order one of these spectacular vinyl play mats. There's space for everything and it smells just like Doctor Zelen's cabin.
Play mats are included with the Red Alert, Officer Candidate, and Blame Bundle pledge levels. Please note that due to their size (700mm × 600mm), the mats will be mailed to you separately.
A parasitic Polymorph and suicidal Fanatic have infiltrated the crew. Now survival isn't the only path the victory in Suicide Mission: a Blame Space micro-expansion exclusive to Kickstarter backers.

About Map Maker physical edition:
The Map Maker PNP version had succeeded as a KS project. The digital files had delivered to all backers. As much as I know, they did love the game. 
You can check the first shot of this game by the link below.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/onepagegaming/map-maker?ref=creator_nav
The full color version of the game was fascinating. But as a none token PNP game, the game sheets are used to record gaming progress which means you have to throw it away after playing. That's a waste.
So, I redesigned the layout and make the game sheets permanent by recording onto other paper. 
Since the game sheets become permanent parts, we don't have to print out hundreds of them. Then we get the chance to use industrial printer to produce high quality pages which home printer could not comparable, and meanwhile we can control the weight of the product (less game pieces) which keeping lower global delivery cost.
Therefore, we launched this campaign - the first game of envelope series.
About Map Maker:
In the fantasy world of sword and sorcery, a map would be the most important thing for an adventure or a dungeon delving which could show you the direction and the danger. 
 At this game, you become a map maker to explore and find out the depth and the boss of each dungeon. Then, write the information down to complete the map. 
 The game is divided into two phases, dungeon delving and boss fighting. At the dungeon delving phase, you roll the dice and choose the encounter according to your hero's stats for each level you descended, then resolve it. Continue the progress until you meet the boss. At the boss fighting phase, you fight the boss following the instruction in boss sheet. Each boss has unique features, skills and actions that you have to use different strategy to fight. 
 Game components: 
1 Wild map 
Wild map
1 Event sheet
Event sheet
 1 Dungeon sheet 
Dungeon sheet
 4 Hero sheets （Fighter, Thief, Mage, Cleric） 
One of the hero sheet
6 Boss sheets  (Skeleton King, Black Dragon, Spider Queen, Goblin Joker, Orc Chief, Adventurer Hunter) 
One of the boss sheet
1 Quick guide
1 Rule book （PDF Version）
 Besides, writing tools and 8 or more six-sided dice need be prepared by player.  
What does the envelope look like?
Please notice that  these are samples, not the last version of the product.
The printer friendly looks like:
Wild map
Map detail
Dungeon sheet
Hero sheet
Boss sheet
Object of the game: 
Delve into the dungeon deeper and deeper until you fighting with a boss. You win the game by defeating the boss. After that, you write the depth, the name of the boss and map maker(your hero) on one site at the wild map as your choice. 
 After completing all 6 sites on the wild map, you finish the map making and the mission is accomplished. 
 Game Play: 
1. Name your hero 
 Give a name to your hero on the Hero Sheet which will be wrote to the Wild Map if you win the game.
Hero sheet
2. Record the course 
 Mark the level you delved in. 
Dungeon sheet
3. Roll the basic dice 
 Roll the dice and put then onto the encounters as their basic dice.
 4. Choose and resolve the encounter 
 Use different attributes to resolve different encounters.
 To do this, you roll 1D6 as a combat die for your hero, add the result to relevant attribute. If you have already unlocked the skills and decide to use it, conduct the skill according to the skill description and modify your score. The result will be your final score. 
 Then, you or any other player(could be start player) roll 1D6 as a combat die for the encounter and add the result to its Basic Die. That will be the score of the encounter. 
 Compare these two scores, if yours is equal to or higher than encounter's, you win the combat. You get 1 experience for this attribute(add 1 attribute). 
 5. Boss fighting 
 If you proceed to the end of dungeon, or get basic dice rolling result higher than Boss Encounter Score while dungeon delving, you immediately encounter the Boss. 
One of the boss sheet
 There are 6 bosses have been designed for this game, and each one is unique. That means you have to fight each boss by different ways. Follow the instruction of each Boss sheet to implement boss fighting until death or wining. 
For the details, check the game rule book please.
https://www.dropbox.com/s/pnimo1plfj5nfa6/Map%20Maker%20Rule%20en%201.1.pdf?dl=0
 About One Page Gaming: 
We love the Role Playing Games. We love the board games. We love the tabletop games. 
However, nowadays, the games are become bigger and bigger. The larger box to store, the bigger place to play, the longer time to game, the thicker book to hold, also more miniatures, more tiles, more cords, more tokens, of cause more and more money. 
 We are not saying the big game is not good. Actually it is fun. But sometimes we do not have a whole afternoon or evening for a large and long time game. We also tired to spent 20 minutes to set up before gaming and another 20 minutes to clear it up after playing. Or we just can't find such a big table. :) 
 Sometimes we really just want to grab a piece of pager and a pencil, perhaps with the addition of several dice to play for a 20 or 30 minutes. If you get such mood frequently, then One Page Gaming is for you! 
 The aim of One Page Gaming is to develop Print and Play game of one or two A4 page size and publish via internet. The gamer need nothing more to play with printed pieces and prepared writing tools and dice. Take them anywhere and play the game whenever you want for less or more than 30 minutes. Without setting up and clearing and have fun at anytime.
About the Envelope Series:
The major conceptions of this series are:  
1. The game is consisted of several pages which be packed in an envelope that easily to carry.  
2. The game sheets are designed to be permanent by the way of recording game progress on other paper. So you can use the game sheets over and over.
3. To reduce the game pieces extremely, the envelope may be designed as a game part.   In this game, the wild map and the map detail will be printed on the front and back of the envelope.  
4. As well controlled product weight, the global air mail system will be used for delivery to keep lower shipping cost.
All in all, easy to carry, easy to play, easy to store, easy to the price. That's the Envelope Series.

campaign.story:
Jackhammers chattering, trucks beeping, engines roaring, the sounds of construction are everywhere. Sprawlopolis is growing and YOU are in charge of it all. The last team of planners couldn’t cut it, so the city turned to your team, the best of the best. If anyone can turn this tiny town into a thriving civic center, it’s you.  
In Sprawlopolis, 1-4 players work together to build a new city from the ground up. Using only 18 cards and a variable scoring system, the game is never the same twice.

First, players will randomly flip over 3 cards to see the scoring rules for the game.  
In this game, you will try to keep Parks away from the edges, line up lots of  Commercial blocks in a row or column, and create roads that connect your Parks.   
But not only do these 3 cards determine how you will score this game, they also determine how you win. Total up the values of all three cards, and that number is the score that you need to reach in order to win.
The example above is just one of many, many combinations (816 to be exact!). Each game has drastically different scoring rules in unique combinations, and a new score to beat, ranging from 6 to 51 points.  
Each turn, players will play one card from their hand to the growing city, trying to score as many points as possible.   
Players will have to communicate and plan without revealing their own cards in order to most efficiently develop large areas in each of the 4 zone types.   
Watch out though, road maintenance isn't cheap, so each road will cost you points in the end.   
When all cards have been placed, the game ends and players see if they have met the dynamically generated minimum score for their game.   
Can you meet the demands of the officials, work with your fellow planners and build the ultimate urban wonder? It’s time to find out!
Sprawlopolis is the next game in our ongoing Wallet Line. Simply 18 cards and rules, packed into a small wallet for maximum portability.

campaign.story:
Inspired by the legendary tales of horror, myth and folklore by Mike Mignola, Hellboy: The Board Game is a fully cooperative experience for 1 to 4 players. You become a member of the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defence (BPRD), ready to investigate occult threats that threaten our very existence. You will explore gothic locations, hunt down clues, discover artefacts, fight horrific creatures and face off against terrifying bosses.
For more details about the 'Box Full of Evil' click here.
For full details of what's included in the Darkness Calls expansion, click here.
 For full details of what's included in the Hellboy in Mexico expansion, click here.
RESIN MINIATURES
For more details on the resin miniatures, please check here.
Designed by James M. Hewitt - the brains behind the likes of Blood Bowl 2016, Necromunda: Underhive, and Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower - Hellboy: The Board Game features incredibly detailed, pre-assembled PVC plastic miniatures that capture the unique look and feel of Mike Mignola’s visionary work.    
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Hellboy: The Board Game gives you the chance to take control of an iconic member of the BPRD. Choose from Hellboy, Abe Sapien, Liz Sherman and Johann Kraus before equipping your agent with additional items that will help in the mission ahead. Each trinket, charm or weapon costs money though, so you’ll need to spend wisely.    
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Each of the missions in the core game begins by reading a BPRD Case File. This will set the scene for the investigation ahead and give hints about what threats you may encounter. The contents of each Case File are top secret, so the first time you play you'll have no idea what you're about to face!   
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
During play, agents must carefully balance the Information Gathered track against the ominous Impending Doom track. Information Gathered represents the clues you uncover about the monster you’re hunting, while the Impending Doom track marks how close humanity is to the brink of destruction.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Do you spend valuable time investigating the scene to find a vital piece of the puzzle that could expose a crucial weakness of your foe, but risk the Impending Doom track reaching its devastating finale? Or do you forget the clues and rush through to a final confrontation before the monster has gathered its strength? No one said being a BPRD Agent would be easy.   
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Ahead of the climatic battle, you’ll have to face all manner of creatures that lurk in the shadows, ready to pounce at a moment’s notice. When the chips are down, it’s time to fight back using an intuitive system of custom coloured dice. Each BPRD agent has a range of special abilities they can use to defeat their enemies, or they can team up when things get really tough.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
What’s more, no two missions will ever play the same thanks to the terrifying Deck of Doom. Each turn players unveil a Deck of Doom card, which could trigger a new onslaught from the arcane horrors hiding in the location, initiate a special event or simply move the Impending Doom track closer to its dramatic end.     
Artwork and text subject to approval.
No matter what your decisions are during the course of the mission, each play through will always end in an epic final confrontation with one of Hellboy's most notorious adversaries. The board itself changes to reveal the boss' lair and then all gloves are off for a desperate struggle against the forces of evil.  
Kickstarter exclusive box artwork drawn by Mike Mignola!
We currently estimate Hellboy: The Board Game (core game) will contain the following components*:
10 double sided room tiles (2.5mm thick, a mix of 2x2 and 1x2 with a linen finish)
4 Agent Cards
50+ cardboard tokens (damage counters, HQ board markers, target priority counters, furniture, doors, flame markers, etc., 2.5mm thick, with a linen finish)
13 custom dice
Three narrative Case File scenarios (tarot card sized, 310GSM, lined finish, each scenario includes between 6-8 cards)
Card HQ Board (linen finish)
74 Mini Cards (310 GSM, linen finish, Encounter Cards, Back-Up Agent details, Equipment and Starting Items)
48 Standard Cards (310GSM, linen finish, Deck of Doom Cards and Enemy Cards)
18 plastic cubes (Agent action tokens and generic black tokens)
Coloured bases to fit on Agents
Rulebook
*these are given as a guidance because the game is currently in development. We will keep backers updated with any changes to components
BPRD ARCHIVES EXPANSION
Also included in your pledge is the BPRD Archives expansion. This is an opportunity for you to create your own BPRD Mission Case File. You start by choosing the location – will it be an abandoned mansion, spooky graveyard, or something more sinister? Then select the foe you want to face in the final confrontation or just leave it to chance, so it's a mystery until the dramatic climax!
Work in progress Case File cards. Artwork/text subject to approval.
Once you’ve created the Case File, it’s time to make the accompanying Deck of Doom. You’ve got complete control to make the game as easy, or as challenging as you want by selecting the Deck of Doom cards and then shuffling them together. These will then be drawn as you're playing through the mission.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Finally choose your Encounter Cards. These will dictate what's inside each room and what monsters you will face. Combine these with your  Enemy Cards to battle against wild creatures, hideous Frog Monsters or Nazi soldiers. The choice is yours!  
Future releases and expansions will feature elements that can be combined with the BPRD Archives, so the experience will keep growing and the gameplay will keep changing long after you've finished your first adventure.
   MINIATURES
We've worked extremely hard to capture the style of the Hellboy comics. Each miniature has been approved by Mike Mignola himself and we've taken his feedback on board to make them as stunning as possible.
PLAY

Each miniature will be made from high quality grey PVC plastic and will be pre-assembled, so they're ready to go straight from the box. As you can see in the image below some of the miniatures are huge and will look amazing during play.  
 The videos below use the prototype components we have been using for playtests. The designs/components used are definitely not final but will give you an idea of how the gameplay works.  

Shipping is NOT included in your pledge and will be calculated/charged once the campaign has completed. We recommend waiting until the pledge manager to add the exact amount required. See below regarding import duties and taxes.   
We currently estimate that the shipping costs for the pledges will be approximately:
UK: £9
USA: £12
Europe: £12
Canada: £14
Australia/New Zealand: £25
Rest of World: £25
All add-ons outside the core pledges will have their shipping calculated and charged in the Pledge Manager after the campaign has finished.
Please note, we are unable to ship to these countries: Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
We are dedicated to our retail partners worldwide therefore we are delighted to offer you a retail pledge for our new Kickstarter.    
Information about the Hellboy retailer pledge can be found here.
Hellboy™ © Mike Mignola. All rights reserved.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a number of risks with any Kickstarter project, especially getting accurate timings for such complex products with so many components. 

With this project, the rules are currently in testing and will require more playtesting, however we have a dedicated team of playtesters to help with this. Many of the miniatures are already designed and approved by Mike Mignola but some are still in concept stage. Once we have all the miniatures designed, the next part of the process is the tooling and production. We predict that we will begin shipping in February 2019 - however, the exact timing is impossible to predict and there is always the potential for delay with products produced in China. We will of course keep our backers up to date as best we can once the project closes.

To date, we’ve successfully fulfilled 11 Kickstarter campaigns: Kings of War, DreadBall, LOKA, Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game, Deadzone, DreadBall Xtreme, Dungeon Saga, Kings of War 2nd Edition, Deadzone: Infestation, The Walking Dead: All Out War and DreadBall Second Edition.

We currently have four outstanding Kickstarters awaiting completion: the remaining Warpath vehicles are shipping to backers now, wave two of Star Saga: The Eiras Contract is currently going into production and is expected to ship shortly afterwards, TerrainCrate will begin shipping in May/June, and for Kings of War: Vanguard the miniatures are in tooling and resin is already in production ready for later this year.

REFUNDS

Upon request refunds may be given within 30 days of the campaign ending, including fees. Following that time, refunds may be given minus Kickstarter and payment fees. In order to request a refund you must contact support@manticgames.com

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By backing this campaign you acknowledge that the components, artwork and game elements for Hellboy: The Board Game are subject to approval by Dark Horse Comics and Mike Mignola. This means some elements may differ from those shown here following the Kickstarter campaign.

If you do not complete the pledge manager within the time specified when the pledge manager is sent, you agree that your contribution to the campaign was a donation and your pledge is fulfilled. Of course, we will use our discretion on a case by case basis. Completing the pledge manager is the ONLY way for us to confirm your shipping address and pledge details, as well as making sure we hit the production timelines. 

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that will pay for any shipping and any import or other duties required in your country. You also accept that you are liable for providing us with the correct shipping details upon request and we are not responsible for items lost in transit if sending to an incorrectly provided address. We also cannot ship to PO boxes and you must provide an alternative shipping in this circumstance.

Although we are aiming to deliver Hellboy: The Board Game to Kickstarter backers before the game is available at retail, production and shipping delays can lead to delivery at the same time or following the retail release. 

If you do not agree to these terms, then please purchase the game once it's available at your friendly local gaming store in 2019.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

At £15,000 we unlocked the new 15 card (ish) module for the expansion!
Wonder Drug module unlocked at £15,000!
New component quality upgrade stretch goal NOW UNLOCKED at £20,000 !
If we can get to £25,000 we will unlock another component quality upgrade!
The "Wonder Drug" module gives secret objectives and a cooperative wonder drug to work on
 £20,000 stretch goal now unlocked!
Based on demand and requests, we have added a £20,000 component quality upgrade! The component to be upgraded will be revealed soon after!
£25,000 stretch goal added!
We've introduced a new £25,000 stretch goal! This will be another component quality upgrade. Can we reach it!?
* Please note the exact number/contents of these cards may slightly change although the mechanisms each contribute are fixed. Similarly, the size of the box may change as we work to get the best fit possible, but it should be no bigger than the size mentioned.
Experience the Pharmaceutical business
Making the most efficacious drugs possible, with the fewest side effects is a noble goal. But it won't make you the most money! And big pharma needs money...
Real molecules!
The groups, atomic weights, chemical names and chemical structures shown are all real molecular structures! All of which have been validated by professionals in the industry. Absorb some real chemistry while you play!
A unique take on drafting
Efficacy and side effects added an extra layer of strategy and replayability to the game. If these metrics are not met by your drafted cards they force you to lose points/cards making collecting the sets a much more intricate thing to do! In effect, the game becomes a question of - how much will you sacrifice to get ahead?
A good game streamlined and improved into a great game
Big Fun and Chu-Lan Kao did some great work, which Kennerspiel des Jahres nominee, Brett Gilbert has worked to streamline and improve. After an additional round of development, we're sure this offers the best possible experience!
A handy sized box!
Pocket Pharma will be the second game in our "Pocket" range. A brain-burning game in a handy sized box! 
Claim fragment cards from the display, and combine them in your lab.
Match the pattern of your fragments to the different drug formulas to create new therapies for some of the world's most prevalent diseases.
Profit from the launch of your new drug — but you must stay below the side effect threshold and match the target efficacy, otherwise the launch will incur losses or disruption to the other compounds you are working on. 
Developing a new drug can be difficult, but being first to market with the right compound can be lucrative!
 Thanks to Slicker Drips for this overview of the base game!
The expansion comprises 40 cards split into 4 exciting modules: mix and match the modules with the base game in any way you wish!

campaign.story:
Submarine theme
While there are quite a few nautical themes, there aren't that many submarine games! 
Submarine meeples!
Because, who wouldn't want cute little submarine meeples!
An abstract nautical game, that is pocket sized and quick to play
Everyone has their go to filler game. We felt that the game hits the right spot in terms of a strategic game, but a filler that plays so quick. The game can take as little as 5 mins to play once setup.
A brain burner, without the space requirements and low price
The game is completely open information, and as such making the right moves count. Therefore for players who like to plan ahead and get "that buzz" of completing an awesome move will get the same, playing Pocket Sub. Even better it is only $14/£11!
Planning ahead is more critical
The whirlpool tokens rotate the tiles, meaning that you must be able to predict where your submarine will end up when it is your turn to play and/or defend itself!

Extra manoeuvrability without extending game time
The intelligence reports, maps and strong current tokens mean that if you use them at the right time, you can make a critical hit/mine laying even more sweet, especially if your opponents weren't expecting them!
Kickstarter exclusive command centres!
You will also get awesome command centres (aircraft carriers) as wooden meeples!
Players can play against one another, or if playing with 4 - play as teams of 2 v 2!
Setup the tiles using the introductory or standard game modes. Each player places their 3 submarines on the board and their command centre.
During each turn, players must move one of their submarines, use exactly 3 movement points (movement allowed based on the terrain) and plant a mine on an exited space. In the example above, the player uses 2 movement points to move onto rocky terrain, places a mine, and moves into an empty adjacent region for their last movement point. 
As the oceans get increasingly cluttered with mines escape/movement becomes increasingly more difficult. Hence planning ahead pays heavily in this game! The player with last remaining submarine wins!

campaign.story:
Can you be the Archmage’s favourite by conjuring the most powerful mythical creatures? Use their unique abilities to bolster your magical powers or hinder your enemies in this game of luck, strategy, magic, and creatures of legend. 
Are you ready for Trick or Treat?
Ember: the popular card game of creature conjuring has just run its final campaign. Trick or Treat sees 30 brand new cards that focus on "take that" mechanics and the addition of Gloom creatures. It also contains all the reworked and playtested Halloween expansion cards, which were requested the fans!
Ember: Trick or Treat Cards (Details are Placeholders)
Ember and its expansions may now be over, but the battle rages on. With almost 300 unique creature cards and a slew of spells, familiars, and artifacts, the game can be enjoyed by everyone.
Missed out on this Campaign?
Don't worry - you can still pick up a copy of Ember at our website. 
ARRIVAL OF THE GLOOM
Trick or Treat Cards (Backgrounds & VP Details are Placeholders)
The Gloom cards are a deck of cards which are shuffled and three are dealt to the table. Anyone can Conjure these cards and use them to their advantage. Each one has powerful endgame changing effects - some modify the VP of Burned creatures while others have wholly more malevolent powers designed to allow you to put those Archmage cards to good use! But be warned, the power of Gloom is powerful and unpredictable and it can easily be a double-edged sword. 
Gloom magic is recommended for advanced Ember players.
HALLOWEEN PROMOS
Ember Halloween Cards (with old-style art)
 You can download the Halloween Cards PDF by clicking here.
A Selection of Gorgeous Creatures from From the Ashes + Promos
WHY BACK TRICK OR TREAT
It's more Ember!
It's got a slew of new art by a fabulous all-female art team.
It's all about the endgame (the final piece of the puzzle I felt needed work right from the very beginning). Now you can really shake things up with a single Archmage card (more on that on my weekly videos).
I've always been a huge fan of making the final score that bit more uncertain and now Trick or Treat gives you just THAT! Now you can manipulate the final VPs of Burned creatures. If that wasn't enough, some of the new creatures are reactionary: when a player does something - you get to do something. It means you can wield absolute power in each game, BUT you might pay a high price for such blatant use of magic. 
Ember is a fast-paced game of creature conjuring. There’s no analysis paralysis here; you use the cards in your hand to conjure a creature based on the creatures you have in play / creatures available on the table / creature to suit your strategy.
From the Ashes Cards
It’s a hand manipulation game. It’s easy to fob off Ember "as another luck game", and it might start that way, BUT… the creatures you collect will allow you to mitigate the “luck of the draw” and to further your chances of conjuring more powerful creatures (by drawing more cards that you need or stripping your enemies of their creatures' powers).
Trick or Treat capitalises on that giving you even more chances to attack your enemies, to weaken their creatures and to strengthen your hold over the game. It's all out war in the Halloween expansion!
It’s not Magic the Gathering - it’s not a game where you hold back cards while you wait for the one you really need - it’s fast and furious - it's opportunistic - it also features countless creatures from mythology - all in glorious technicolour!  
Ember is played over multiple rounds, split between two phases. The Draw Phase and the Conjuring Phase.
During the Draw Phase you will discard one or more cards from your hand to draw more cards to aid you in your creature conjuring efforts.
An Average Hand of Cards in Ember
In the Conjuring Phase you will discard two or more cards in your hand to conjure just one creature from the Pool (the randomly determined set of creatures and magical items available to you in any particular game of Ember. The more creatures you have, the more random each game will be). Each creature has a unique ability, so the creature you most need might not necessarily be the one with the highest Victory Point score.
The Pool of Available Cards (From the Ashes)
Play continues with players discarding and drawing cards, BUT the strength of Ember is that you can use your creatures' powers at any time, thus aiding your own conjuring attempts or thwarting your opponents. Card powers range from allowing you to draw extra cards to being able to deflect one of your opponent's abilities to another target.
Hummingbird Phases: Ready to Exhausted.
The game ends when one player reaches the agreed Victory Point score OR they accumulate a number of Ember Points - cards that are added to the Pool when all the creatures in one VP Rank are conjured (to be revealed in Stretch Goals).
A Selection of Gorgeous Creatures from From the Ashes
During the Endgame, each player takes it in turns to use their creatures' abilities, to Burn (turn face down and make powerless) or Regenerate creatures with Archmage cards and to generally do everything they can to gain those final few Victory Points. Once everyone has passed, the game ends and the final scores are totalled. Final scores may be affected by Tutor cards (in From the Ashes). 
The winner is the wizard with the highest score in VPs.
Download the Rulebook
Download the Complete Card List (we've not included the Second Edition - yet - to avoid spoilers!)
Archmage Stewie Showing Off the Cards
Ember: The Wizard Playing Cards
The Wizard cards make up the majority of the Draw Deck and allow you to Conjure creatures, one creature for each of your turns. 
Ember: Trick or Treat consists of just one tuck box of 30 cards of the highest possible quality with all new art. You are getting:
15 x Gloom cards
15 x Halloween-themed cards that add a whole "take that" element to Ember. Now there's more revenge when someone makes you discard a card (or three). Get your own back!
The new cards are also standalone, so if you have a Wizards deck, you can play Ember with these cards. Exciting! It's guaranteed to be a very different game to anything you've played before. 
We've started with 30 cards, but our Stretch Goals plan for A LOT more!!! I'll be showing you more of the cards over the campaign so stay tuned!
WHAT DO I NEED TO PLAY EMBER?
All you need to play a standard game of Ember is:

The Wizards is a deck of 55 playing cards which make up the four elements of magical energy you need to Conjure creatures in Ember. It also includes three powerful Archmage cards.

campaign.story:
Comic Turns is a comics storytelling game system – a deck of cards where each has a comic panel all carefully designed so that they can be arranged in any order to make countless new comic strips and infinite stories.
PLAY Have fun creating collaborative stories with your friends and family, or compete to see who can make the best one! More games and solo play challenges will be added to the Comic Turns website.
EXPLORE Discover how comics work and how stories are structured. Plot your stories visually with no need for words.
CREATE Shuffle the deck and pick random cards to inspire your own creative works. Beat writer's block and procrastinator's brain!
 Comic Turns is suitable for all ages from 7 upwards. It contains no words, meaning it can be played anywhere with speakers of any language, as well as being accessible for children and adults with low literacy or difficulty reading. There is great potential for Comic Turns to be used as an educational aid not just for making comics and creative writing, but for literacy, language learning and discussion.
   All the images of the game shown in the video and pictures are of the prototype deck. The manufactured decks will be high quality 300gsm card in a lovely gloss-varnished tuckbox. The cards are standard Poker size 63x88mm
I've included four different ways to play in the deck: A warm-up activity to get the creative juices flowing, and three games - two collaborative and one competitive. Each are suitable for ages 7+ and for 1-6 players. But this is not the end … Comic Turns is a Game System. There are many different ways to play, perhaps infinite ways. I want to encourage players to submit their own ideas for games to the Comic Turns website, as well as adding more sets of rules myself over time, so that Comic Turns is constantly evolving, and there are always new ways to use your deck of cards. 
Play by the rules, make up your own rules, or play with no rules at all!
      The rules will be made available in multiple languages on the Comic Turns website. At the moment I'm looking at having them translated into Chinese, Czech, Danish, Dutch, French, Italian, Japanse, Swedish and Turkish. Maybe even more!
   I am a comics artist from London, UK. I work freelance, and make comics both professionally and as an indie creator making self-published work.  
Back in 2009, I was the V&A's Comics Art Resident, spending six months in this world class museum making artwork, teaching workshops and holding open studio events. This was when the idea for Comic Turns was first conceived, as a deck of comic strip playing cards called Hand of Fate...
I have been teaching workshops and courses on making comics to children, adults and teens for the past ten years, working with schools, libraries and museums across the UK, and  abroad! As an educator, seeing how much students and other educators loved Hand of Fate and found it great for learning and teaching comics was part of what made me really want develop it as a game for all, and to get it out to a wider audience. Hence this Kickstarter for the product it became: Comic Turns. 
I love any activity that involves making stories with others and creating collective hive minds: role playing games, collaborative art and writing, storytelling and teaching. I hope you will join the Comic Turns hive mind with me and make it buzz!
  “It's an amazing game to play as it allows you to think of a lot of plots and comics. Rating 100000/10” Aisha, 12 
“Fun, interesting. I liked the way that you could put anything anywhere and you can still make a story.” Chisomo, 12
“It was very fun and I really enjoyed it. You can play it alone or with friends which makes it even better. 10/10” Aravind, 11
"Every now and then you see an idea that's so brilliant you stop and think 'I wish I'd thought of that!' One such concept is Comic Turns." Lew Stringer
"Comic Turns is a fantastic enigmatic multi purpose little deck. It's a great game, a mix of Cards Against Humanity, Story Cubes, and dominos. It's also a great prompt for writers, like Brian Eno's Oblique Strategies cards.... Whatever you use them for, the images and the endless combinations and juxtapositions possible with them are fascinating." Leah Moore  
"I've used Karen Rubins's fantastic comic cards for over 6 years now with everyone from children to grannies and in workshops all over the world from Russia to Mexico, so I can confidently say that everyone loves them! The cards allow you to put the tools of storytelling straight into the participant's hands. Making up stories is so easy when you can bounce off these cards and they inspire even the most novice of storytellers to pick up their own pens and have a go at creating their own visual stories." Karrie Fransman
“Once upon a time there was a clever comics creator named Karen Rubins... Karen came up with all kinds of wizard ideas to entertain visitors and herself. One of them was a limited edition special deck of playing cards that had comic panels on each card showing varying actions and happenings that you could use to tell a variety of stories... Despite advice from a respected fellow creator in the comics business to produce this excellent object for a wider spread of buyers, Karen let much time go by before realising the error of her ways.” David Lloyd
Review by Chris Michelotti of Foolish Panda Games: "This is a fast and fun game to bring out for kids to develop both creative thinking and their ability to tell stories."
  Review by Dice at Dusk's Eddie Stanton: "It pushed me to create a decent story, I really liked that about it." "It's a great way to keep those creative ideas flowing through your head."
   "An elegantly simple story telling card game suitable for all ages," says Richard from We're Not Wizards. Listen to a whole podcast interview where we talk about Comic Turns among other things. We're Not Wizards Podcast
    "It was fun. I liked that you can make your own story." BarbarianLeaf, "You could have loads and loads and loads of fun." GamerLeaf, from Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf's Family Friday podcast.
  To make Comic Turns a reality I need to raise money to manufacture the game and get it into the hands of backers. That is all I am asking for my main goal. Any additional funds will be spent on improving the product, and making it more accessible to more players – through a dedicated website, rules translations, getting tables at more shows and cons than I can currently afford by myself and manufacturing more decks. I'd also love to develop expansion decks! Comic Turns is about making stories together, so it would be great to fund it together too. Let's make this campaign into the best story we can! 
     Free shipping within the UK is included with all pledges. By keeping the game a small size we can send it quite cheaply and easily anywhere in the world. Our shipping is from within the EU so EU backers can benefit from low shipping charges and no taxes to receive your items. Shipping for all rewards is £8 (approx $11USD) or less for worldwide shipping, and £5 (approx €6) or less for postage within Europe.
   Wow! We've made the funding total! So you will definitely get a lovely card game. But maybe you want a few extra fun things?
 We have reached our first Stretch Goal!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter and my first game design project, and I'm doing it pretty much by myself. So those are risky bits! However, I've been self-publishing comics for well over a decade, so I have a good track record of getting projects finished and manufactured, working with printers, and making sure everything is of a high standard. The majority of the design work is complete already, there are only a few finishing touches and alterations needed and I'm ready to go to manufacture. Only the rules need to be finessed and finalised. I have a manufacturer lined up and ready to go. There are very few moving parts that can go wrong with this project, I'm pretty confident it will all be just fine.

campaign.story:
In addition to all of the reviews, previews, playthrus, trivia, interviews—oh! and cool intro videos—that Tantrum House has become known for, this past season we also introduced a brand new Podcast. We've started putting together plans for our first TantrumCon Boardgaming Convention AND we have plans for starting up a brand new fourth studio: Studio Awesome (which will help us focus some attention on RPGs and tactical strategy games)! It all depends on your support though!! Scroll down to learn about the promo items that we are giving away and what your funds will help us to produce in 2018!
That means Seasons 1+2+3 = 183 videos.
And in Season 4 ALONE we produced 199!! We've found stride! 
  With your support, one of the things we'll be able to do this season is start recording at our 4th studio! We need to purchase lighting, updated audio equipment, and a video rig. To say "Thank You" for the support, we'd like to humbly offer the following items:
Promo Packs: Several publishers have graciously offered to make their existing promos available through us and a few have even partnered with us to create custom limited-edition promos! Check out all the awesome stuff you can get your hands on for your support. 
    Right now we're offering discounted pricing on a few of the items that are normally available only through our Etsy shop.  
   Here's what we're hoping to accomplish with your help!
  We've started referring to ourselves as a board game media company. We make all kinds of videos that promote and share the hobby, and we also offer writing, photography, design and videography services to other Makers in our gaming community. 
It’s been a quick couple of years since we founded Tantrum House, and the thing we've enjoyed the most (well, besides playing board games) is YOU! we’re grateful for you—our friends, families, and fans—who have made it all possible. Thanks for your support! We love to hear from you, meet up with you at game conventions, play your awesome prototypes and be a part of this amazing board gaming community with you. If we haven’t met yet, don’t be a stranger! It would be great to connect with you on Facebook, through email, or at our local game nights. We recently updated our website so that you can connect names to faces and keep an eye out for us at gaming conventions. This year we’re looking forward to another fantastic season of board game reviews, crazy playthru videos, and more Cons than you can count on one hand (you six-fingered people are excluded)! Thanks for being awesome! Without you, there is no Tantrum House.
We've begun working on a few videos for Season 5 already. Check out this quick behind-the-scenes documentary and learn more about our process, our focus on producing the highest quality of productions, and a little bit more about the people behind the camera.
  One last shout-out and especially HUGE “Thank You!” to all the publishers and game designers who helped support this campaign. We’re so blessed to work with you all! We couldn't do what we do if it weren't for their support and generosity.

campaign.story:
Wibbell++ is a game system.
I want to make it the best-curated game system ever.
With 48 cards, each featuring a pair of letters, number and border, you can play countless games.
Of course some of those games are about making words. Some of the word games also involve speed, memory, set collection, or just force you to think about words in an entirely new way.
Some of the games are about language. They encourage you to invent stories or phrases.
Some games are completely abstract! Some are about matching things quickly, one is about creating sets of patterns as you use numbers for auctions, a few are about using the alphabet as an arbitrary order for symbols (i.e. letters) to be arranged into.
  (borders will be red in 2nd edition and some letters redrawn)
WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
48 cards, each featuring a common letter, a less common letter, a number (that tells you how often the lower letter appears) and one of 6 borders. This is the core!
7 bonus cards, with the card back, and either just one of 6 borders or a fully blank front.
An informational sheet about the deck.
Rulesheet for WIBBELL - a fast realtime wordgame that tests your ability to make words under pressure.
Rulesheet for GRABBELL - a speedy, frantic pattern-matching game.
Rulesheet for PHRASELL - a creative game that tests your mastery of the language.
Rulesheet for FAYBELL - a storytelling activity.
Rulesheet for ALPHABETICKELL - an abstract game that tests your analytical skills.
Rulesheets for COUPELL - a highly co-operative 2-player word game.
A sturdy-and-compact-yet-fancy box with actual shiny cold-pressed gold foil.
That's 6 games, and all of them are made with love and thorough attention to detail. They have been thoroughly tested.
But which ones are the best?
There are 6 'core' games and each year - until I retire - I will add another game to that list on BezDay (1st August). No game will be for everyone but they will all be worth trying. They will be focused on over the preceding year, with blind-tested rule sheets and professional proof-reading as a final touch. 
A website will be rebuilt. Everyone can submit their game ideas and I consider it my duty and pleasure to continue designing for the deck, test all the submitted games, help with development as needed, and let everyone search through and vote on hundreds of games.
Whether you want solitaire games, educational activities, quick games for the pub or deeper games to play over an hour, they already exist. And more will be coming.
There are enough games and infinite possibilities. I will do my utmost to help guide you towards those games that you will enjoy the most. By contributing to this KS, you are helping me on this mission: to make the best curated game system ever.
The first-edition deck
  Nearly 2 years ago, I Kickstarted Wibbell++.
I made something good, which I'm very proud of.
As planned, I spent the following year developing the graphics and drawing the lettershapes. With the help of my backers, I created a 1st edition box that has been enjoyed by countless people around the globe!
I have shown it to hundreds of people around the world - in one single convention, I played over 200 games of Wibbell! And I went to 11 conventions last year and hosted many more events/gamenights. I have the luxury of hindsight and have had time to consider each and every aspect of the deck
Now I want to make something even better.
I will be using all the feedback I've gotten over the past 6 months.
The box will be a compact 2-piece box that is a near-perfect fit for the deck. I have a sample that I've literally jumped on and generally mistreated. It still functions perfectly as a box.
The tree was a lovely way to celebrate the birth of the game system, but I'd like a stark, bold version of the card back on the front of the box. 
After the KS is funded, I will start showing you thumbnails, then sketches, then more sketches, then final art for the outer box sides, inner box sides and back of box.
I will do my utmost to make this a beautiful box that you are proud to have displayed on a table, or bring out of your bag.
I am redrawing S, G, O and maybe Y to help make these letters as readable as possible.
The rules - instead of being on cards - are on rulesheets. This allows me to use 11-point text for the main rules and explain things with greater clarity. There will also be space for more diagrams and even helpful tips/strategies to get you started.
The borders will be a brownish red and the numbers slightly fainter, to better focus attention on the letters.
Some borders will be swapped.
After observing thousands of games, a few rules are changing slightly. For 1st edition owners, these will of course be up on the website.
The cards will be 320gsm linen-finish. This feels nice when you're playing with it.
The box will be literally shiny, with cold-stamped gold foil.
You could consider it a 'deluxe' version. 
I think that you should definitely back this KS. But I'm clearly biased. 
Here's some quotes from some less-biased folk.
(Click on any of the quotes for a link - each quote is from a reviewer or someone online. None were ever paid by me. Some review copies were sent. Unlinked words are my own.)
    2-7 players, 10-15 minutes
Shout words quickly, but make sure to use
A letter from every card or you lose.
"It gets increasingly difficult as soon as you start getting your cards." - Cassie Elle
"There's a really devilish little strategy" "It has that word-on-the-tip-of-your-tongue feel, where you're all pent up" - Ding & Dent
"It's about your speed of thinking rather than just being the 'smartest' person." - Toucan Play That Game
"Super fast." "Super portable." "Setup is super simple." - What's Eric Playing
"The race-based tension of Wibbell can re-energise tired gamers." - Games Night Guru
"stunningly brilliant" - Creaking Shelves
"Wibbell is the first word game I enjoyed in a very long time. It is fast, fun and has a great catch up mechanic." - Big Red Barrell
  2-7 players, 2-3 minutes
  "A quick thirty-seconds-to-a-minute action game." - The Offline Gamer Podcast
You grab cards as quickly as you can - but each card you grab must match a letter or border with the previous card. Whenever you want, slap the table and eliminate yourself.
"Everybody except the last person is going to get 10 bonus points. But they get all the cards on the table! So you're trying to do some math: how many cards are on the table? When should I slap my hand?" - Bower's Game Corner
"The winner is the person that manages to pick up the most of those cards and survive the ruthless audit on their work that will be conducted by the player to their left." - Meeple Like Us
"quite a lot of fun...because of the race element, and the mess, and the clever use of the borders" - Board Deck & Dice
"A really fast, simple, fun little dexterity game."- Cardboard Cultist
"Grabbell is simply ludicrous, in a good way." - Games Night Guru
  2-4 players, 15-30 minutes
First you use the cards to inspire 4 story elements.
"EP might be Exploding Possum or Elemental Parka or Everyday Person" - Meeples Like Us
Then you take turns to tell a story involving these elements in that order.
"The first player flips over the top card of the deck and creates a starting sentence using the top letter of the card. In addition, a separate word must start with the bottom letter of the card. As example, if the card flipped had the letters “E” and “M” the player could start the story with “Early morning mist surrounded the city.” He/she would also come up with a word for the letter “M” such as “murdered”. The next player would flip a card and come up with a sentence using the top letter of their card and would need to include the word “murdered” into their sentence. This activity does not involve winning or losing and is more about simply having fun." - Board Game Doctor
"Just enough rules and restrictions to give it some structure and challenge, to make it a game, but leaves you in the driving seat." - Creaking Shelves
  5-15 players, 15-25 minutes
First the judge uses a card to inspire any topic they wish.
'The judge then flips over two more cards and the other players have to think of a 4-word phrase about the topic beginning with those 4 letters (in any order). For example with the topic 'fox' and the cards RD/WN, Joe came up with "Night-Wandering Red Dog".' - BGG comment
[RH] and [SL] could be "'Rebel Halflings Love Sauron!’, ‘Red Hot Shire Loving!’, ‘Second Lunch: Rarely Hot’, and so on." - Meeple Like Us
 "You don't get a designated turn, where you think of what you want to say and then say it. But I personally actually like that because people are just shouting stuff out, and then crazy stuff is just popping out of your head..." - Bower's Game Corner
"Andrew's 'Someone Call Nurse Fatima' had no relevance to the subject, but he won the round anyway. It's that kind of game." - Games Night News
"Again, super quick and super easy to play but still packing a considerable amount of fun into the svelte box" - Meeple Like Us
"Does what the best party games do: let you appreciate your friends’ wit and humour." - Creaking Shelves
"It makes a great after-dinner game and is hilarious and revealing by turns." - Games Night Guru
2-5 players, 20-30 minutes
Alphabetickell is all about choosing cards that fit at the start or end of a line of letters (not in the middle). Originally designed by Andrew Dennison in 2015, I developed it and eventually removed the speed component. (There is no video because the turn-based nature changed it enough to invalidate previous comments and interviews.)
At a basic level, it's a simple game suitable for families.
If you delve more deeply, there is a lot of analysis involved - based on memory of the cards gone, knowledge of other players' desires, and understanding the uneven distribution and probabilities involved.
"part luck, part strategy and part knowing your ABCs." - Big Red Barrell
" It is… not as easy as it sounds." - Meeple Like Us
"It's simple but offers some fun strategy, like so many of the games in Wibbell++" - Cardboard Cultist
"Once again, the fact that so many little decisions are buried in here, makes this a treat!" - Creaking Shelves
"Very good fun at 2-player." - Toucan Play That Game
  2 players, 30-45 minutes
A 2-player co-operative game. You help each other make longer words, by working on each other's rows of cards and trying to stay in perfect balance.
At the end of the game, your scores need to be exactly equal!
As it wasn't included in the 1st edition deck, it's been overlooked slightly. In the 2nd edition deck, full rules will be included of course.
"It works really nicely." "Perfect restaurant game [or] on an aeroplane" - Rahdo Runs Through
1 player, 10-20 minutes
 Puzzell will be the 7th 'core' game, with full development, blind-testing and proof-reading completed by 1st August 2018.

You must lay out all the cards but are only allowed to lay cards when creating 'runs', i.e. fragments of the alphabet. There are 20 setups to beat, and any will setup might play differently when you shuffle and play again.
  IN CONCLUSION
It's unlikely that all 6 core games will be perfect for you. Hopefully you'll enjoy all those you get a chance to try, but maybe you'll find yourself hating the physicality of Grabbell, or hating the deep cognitive load of Coupell. Maybe you don't like activities - you only like games. Maybe you don't like mixing games with creativity. Or maybe you don't like the somewhat abstract nature of Alphabetickell.

Even Wibbell itself - the most universally enjoyed game in the deck - has some who hate its rowdy nature.
I do believe, however, that there will almost certainly be a game here for you.

If your sensibilities align with mine - enjoying lighter games, word games, party games - then this deck will bring you to gaming Nirvana. If you prefer heavier games, it's possible that another designer (such as David Brain, who has done some sterling work on this deck) is already working on games for your tastes.

And you'll be able to keep the whole thing in your pocket.
Thanks for reading.
 - Bez
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have completed 3 physically mass-produced projects for KS projects and hope I've proven my capability to do a 4th. I always do my own art/writing. In this instance, I have less artwork to do, more developed skills for writing rules, and more connections in place for blind-testing/proof-reading.

The games are 100% rules-complete and thoroughly tested.

Some assets (rule diagrams, box art, S, G, O) need to be drawn. I hope to be able to involve backers in the creation of the box art. In the past, only 0-8% of my art has been done before a KS so I am much further along and expect a correspondingly swift turnaround.

I have a printer lined up - Fabryka Kart, who printed my 1st edition deck. They have given me plenty of samples and I am intimately familiar with the new box. 

I know they are able to deliver in a relatively short timeframe. The decks will come from Poland without any ships involved.

I will post the game myself - packing and sending the envelopes as I'm able and then sending via Royal Mail from London, UK. This will take a couple of weeks so I'll have to ask you to be patient during this process.

The main challenge will simply be the continued focus and organisation of time in the face of whatever life throws at me. A more terminal risk is that I might get run over by a bus. But if I did, I hope you'd sympathise and you'd be sadder for the loss of my life than the loss of your game. 

The main risk is the postal service. Some packages take longer than others and some are unreliable - specially when going overseas. 

Also, since I am personally fulfilling all orders, it will take me longer than usual to fulfill. 

I hope that everyone will get their copies in June/July. But it may even be that a few folk get it in August. 

My plan is:
Feb - KS
March/April - art/completion of everything
May/June - printing/delivery to me (UK)
June/July/August - folk get their games

until I retire - I keep making games for the deck and helping others with their own ideas

Ultimately, your realistic worst-case scenario (given my track record) is that they come a little later than you hope, or you are the last person in the world to get your copy. 

A couple of months after everything is sent and things have had time to make their way around the world (even if the postal service in your country is being especially nosy) I will put out an update and start re-sending stuff that failed to arrive. You will get your stuff. 

Conversely, the benefit is that you will get a brilliant package that has games made for it for many decades to come. And you're directly supporting someone trying to help make the world a happier place via games. 

I think that's a pretty good risk-benefit ratio.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Files were sent to the printer yesterday. In the final checks, a couple of mistakes were spotted and things were fixed and resent today.

I confirmed with Trefl that I need 1,000 copies of this printed (along with 1,000 copies of Kitty Cataclysm, which I always wanted to print at the same time).

The box will be literally shiny.

There will be instructions for 6 games. Coupell's piece of paper is nearly A3. Everything else is slightly smaller than A4, to fit the box perfectly.

There is an 'info sheet' and a 'card list', that lists the card in all 4 ways: by border, top letter, bottom letter and number.

There will be 48 cards in the box.

The 7 remaining cards in the sheet will be sent to me separately. All KS backers will be able to get these 7 extra cards for free - they have the same back but the fronts are designed for you to use if you're making new cards, maybe for adapting it into another language. Or for experimenting with, if you like.

I hope you will like the games.

I hope the cards will come out well. I've never bothered with a physical proof and I won't get one for this project. I've felt enough cold-pressed gold-foil boxes, felt the same boxes from the same printer, seen their paper for the original Wibbell++ and felt their linen-finish cards.

I just want to get these over as soon as possible. I'm excited to actually start playing with these new, slightly nicer, cards. And I'm sure many of you feel the same way.

campaign.story:
We would like to invite you to join us at The City of Games 2018, a 3 day gaming convention in the heart of Bristol City during the 9 - 11 February 2018.
Open Gaming: There will be hundreds of games you can pick up and play during the weekend from the old classics to the latest Gen Con and Essen releases.
Find a Group: Our modern looking for group system will help you find people to play with.
Learn a Game: Our volunteers will be on hand to help teach you new games.
Social Games: In the evenings we'll be running social games such as Werewolf and have a variety of Party games on offer.
Dexterity Games: We will have a selection of dexterity games ready to go including Crokinole, Tumblin-Dice and Pitch Car Racing
Tournaments: We'll be hosting several fun tournaments for people of all levels, including the Dobble championships!
Buy Games: There will be a selection of games on sale at the event.
If you are new to board gaming, or are only familiar with games like Monopoly, Cluedo and Risk then The City of Games is a great opportunity to try something new. Our team of volunteers will be on hand to teach you some gateway games and introduce you to something new.
* All requested games must be in print and attainable from our local game stores. You must submit the game name within 1 month of the Kickstarter ending.
The town records are our way of recording the history of The City of Games.  
Each year we will be adding all of those who attended to the Town Records, and we will continue to update this each year.  
As a way to further support The City of Games 2018, we are offering unique roles where you will be listed in the Town Records as the role you selected. There are no physical benefits to selecting these roles, but as a thank you, we will offer free standard entry to future events for a set number of years.  
Please note, all names entered into the town records must be family friendly and we hold the right to exclude words we believe to be offensive.
* We hope The City of Games will become an annual convention and these roles have been created in order to help us to achieve that. However, we cannot guarantee future conventions will happen and will not be able to offer refunds should we decide to cancel future events. Please see these roles as a way of supporting us, and take the free entry to future events as a nice bonus should they happen.
 Throughout the Kickstarter we will be adding more events and guests to the page. If there is anything specific you would like us to do, then please suggest it in the comments!
No Pun Included, a UK based board gaming couple who make funny and informative board game reviews will be our guests for the entire weekend. If you’re not familiar with their videos, then I highly recommend watching some on YouTube! It’s great to have them join us for our first event and hopefully you will get an opportunity to play something with them!
Paul Grogan from Gaming Rules! and CGE will be demoing games over the weekend, including the latest releases from Czech Games Edition, and some new prototypes of games in development.
 We would like to offer you the chance to take part in a Mega Game or Board Game Jam, but in order to do so we need at least 12 people. So during the Kickstarter we will be giving you the ability to unlock these events by signing up.
How to sign up

1) Please purchase a ticket for The City of Games,.
2) Increase your pledge by £2.
3) Finally send us a message on Kickstarter or leave a message in the comment section.
You need to have a ticket for The City of Games in order to sign up for the Mega Game and Board Game Jam. As we have now sold out of tickets for the convention, I'm afraid these events are no longer available to people without tickets.
Once 12 people have signed up, the event will be unlocked. Both events are limited to 36 people.
The Mega Game will take place on Saturday and the Board Game Jam will start on Saturday and finish on Sunday. I'm afraid this does mean you will only be able to participate in 1 of the 2 events. 
 To increase your pledge, click the green "manage pledge" button at the top of the page and increase the amount by £2.
 The event is being held at Future Inns, which is just outside of Cabot Circus in the centre of Bristol city. 
The address of the venue is: Future Inn, Cabot Circus, Bond St S, Bristol. BS1 3EN.
Accommodation can be arrange with the venue through the Future Inns website. Staying at the hotel will grant you 24 hour access to the game rooms, so you wont have to leave when the clock strikes midnight.
Parking is available in the Cabot Circus car park and we have a limited number of discount codes which we can offer to those who request them.
We picked our venue not only because it was great for the event, but because it was in the heart of the city and surrounded by things to do. There are over 20 nearby restaurants, a cinema, escape rooms and a indoor crazy golf centre.
We are working with local companies to offer a more complete experience and want to thank them all for helping us to make The City of Games 2018 happen.
Area 51 will be running a game store throughout the weekend allowing you to pick up new games.
Chance & Counters will be running a social games event on the Saturday evening.
Puzzlair are giving us access to 6 different escape rooms all weekend long.
Auroch Digital are running the Board Game Jam and will be setting the design task for the weekend.
If you are interested in sponsoring the event then please feel free to message us.
The City of Games 2018 is being organised by Frank West and Sara Jorge. Frank is a full time game designer and creator of The City of Kings, Sara is a Biotechnologist and board game enthusiast.
We are investing our own money into The City of Games 2018, so the convention will be happening in 2018 no matter what. We’re here on Kickstarter looking to raise extra money which will help us make The City of Games the best it can be from day one.
The money will go towards growing the games library, organising more events and tournaments, prizes and aesthetics to enhance your gaming experience. We have a whole host of ideas for the venue to help create an amazing space for our community to meet, chat, game, and relax.
Your support on Kickstarter can make it happen.
Refund Policy. Please note, due to the nature of this event once the Kickstarter has finished we will not be able to offer refunds. If you no longer wish to come, we will be happy to transfer your ticket to someone else, or simply change your pledge to a supporter tier.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Running a convention can be challenging, so we have been planning The City of Games for nearly 2 years to make sure the event goes as smoothly as possible. We have travelled to countless conventions around the UK, and the world, learning what makes a convention great. We have been talking with the organisers of other events and taking notes from the experiences they have had.

The biggest risk to us is we don’t sell enough tickets, this will make it difficult to add all the nice extras we would like to include, and this is why we are running the Kickstarter. The 2018 event is going to happen no matter what, but with your support we hope we can make this event big enough to turn this into an annual event, putting The City of Games on every gamers map.
