campaign.story:
ORE-SOME! is a frantic day in the mine played over 6 rounds of 2 phases each. The miner who makes the most money at the end of the day is declared the winner!
In the Move Phase, players move, ram and block each other for the best spots to dig. Rammed carts drop precious ore that can be swiped if you're quick and cunning!
In the Dig Phase, players take turns digging for, stealing or swiping dropped ore. Once they have the ore, they can sell it to the bank or rush to the Contract Agents to fill valuable contracts!
How to win!
In ORE-SOME you'll be playing Lewis, Zoe, Jessie or Doc Francis - miners pushing and pulling unreliable minecarts around a maze-like mine - competing to gather the most ore, fill the most contracts and ultimately earn the most gold in a single day!
Setting Up
First you'll build the mine.
Players will take turns placing mine tiles. There's normal tiles and a special tile for each player where you'll earn double if you dig there but no-one gets to place their own special tiles!
Everybody Move!
Everybody rolls a dice. Then you take turns moving your cart 1 to 3 tracks depending on the roll. 
Don't like what you rolled? Hidden Springs, Whack the Lever, Oil Slick or Uphill can help you get where you want to be. 
So can slamming into walls or, even better, other players!
Be careful! Any time ore drops from your cart it stays where it is and someone might swipe it before you can get back to it! 
Watch your back! If other players hit you - you're shunted! You'll end up where you didn't want to be and if your cart's really full you'll drop a piece of ore too!
Dig!
After moving, everyone takes turns working the tile they've ended up on.
On your turn you dig for ore: two on a normal tile, four on your special tiles! Keep your hands steady if your cart is bursting, the dropped ore rule still counts!
You can also (once!) pick up any ore on your tile - whether you dropped it or not!
You can also hand in contracts or sell to the Bank. 
If you want to hand in contracts - you better have the right ore and be in range of the contract agents! They roam the mine looking for the player with the most ore, the least ore, the closest cart or the youngest player so you might need to hold on to that ore an extra turn or two. Or play it safe and sell to the bank for less cash...
Draw!
At the end of your turn you can discard any cards you don't want and then fill your hand back up to five.
And More!
We've not even talked about Dynamite, Cave-ins, Jackpots, Pickaxes or Scraps, our adorable pup who'll ride around in your cart - protecting you from thieves and sabotage!
Y'all might want to have a read of our beautiful rulebook:
Click to read!
or watch the guys from Man vs Meeple talk you through it:
If we exceed the funding we need to make ORE-SOME a reality, we're ready to put that extra funding to work making it the best game we can. All we need is your help to do it!
What's more, the stretch goals will be unlocked from the combination of kickstarter pledges and retailer sales during the campaign!

campaign.story:
Introducing Mined Out: a pocket-sized game of far deeper proportions that throws you deep into a dark and treacherous mine in search of precious gems.  
With colourful illustrations, arcade-inspired mechanics and fast-paced gameplay, it's a game that can entertain families and satisfy players of any level.  
Mined Out is small enough to take anywhere, and deep enough to engage even the most strategy-obsessed players.
In Mined Out, players explore their own personal mines, displayed over a set of 12 different square cards, with billions of potential combinations guaranteeing a unique mine every time you play.
Players allocate limited Action Points to moving around their mine, collecting gems, building useful upgrades, securing hazardous areas of the mine, and sabotaging others with dynamite!
Once one player has built all of their upgrades, the player with the highest scoring combination of gems, upgrades and explored mine cards wins!
  Just click the graphic!
          Click for the review!
    Click for the review!
     Click for the review!
              Having run our previous campaign for Downsize earlier this year, we were keen to find out what backers of that campaign thought of our performance - and we were pleasantly surprised by their response!
   With the exception of the rules, Mined Out is entirely language independent, making it easy to learn with the use of alternative language PDFs.  
In addition, Mined Out is colourblind friendly, with different-shaped gems and high contrast illustrations ensuring that anyone can play.
   With the benefit of hindsight from our previous campaign for Downsize we’ve been able to fine-tune a manufacturing and fulfilment plan that will jump into action as soon as Mined Out is funded.
Playtesting Mined Out!
 The manufacturing files are completed and ready to go, and our fulfilment team is on standby to deliver your games quickly and without the threat of pesky customs charges.  
We hope that you put your trust in us a second time around to help make Mined Out into the success that it's waiting to be!
Thank You!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
On our last project, we had a few small problems, but got past them quickly, and successfully delivered on the project. Here is what we've done this time around to ensure that things go even smoother:

- Having gone through it once already and found people that we work well with and trust, we've been able to create a much more thorough plan for manufacturing and fulfilment, with realistic projections and a better understanding of the processes involved.

- We've got the manufacturing specifications and templates out of the way this time, rather than waiting until once the project is finished to see what we have to precisely do to get the game made.

- On our last project, the vast majority of backers got their games without customs charges. The exception to this rule was Denmark, and so this time we have adopted a different tactic for this region to ensure that absolutely nobody gets customs charges.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Midnight at Alastor's Academy and the apprentice wizards have gathered in the nearby woods, where, huddled around the flames of a campfire with a bottle of StarMead, the young wizards play a game. Someone casts a shard of TrueFire into the cool midnight sky; whichever wizard can siphon off the elemental magic to conjure the most powerful mythical creatures is the winner. This is Ember.
These are three of the FREE promo cards you can get with the Stretch-Goal related mini expansion "The Darke". Find out more about The Darke expansion as we move into this final weekend.
Brand New Rules: The inclusion of Rules 1.6 mean that Ember is a very different game - but don't worry - all cards are fully compatible with previous versions, the 1.6 rules see a very tense and exciting game filled with random creature powers that can utterly change the way Ember plays.
Download the new version 1.6 rules here. 
LIGHT AND DARK supercharges your game with twenty new cards across two exciting packs - each packed with game-changing mechanics. There's a lot to deal with in Light and Dark!
PRISMATIC PACK £5. The Prismatic pack boosts your creatures' abilities and adds a whole new collection of magical monsters to Conjure. 
SPECTRAL PACK £5: Introduces ten creature cards that curse and hinder your enemies with dark magic. Conjure these creatures and steal the Victory Points for yourself, while the cards curse your enemies with powers that range from stripping the cards in their hand to making their creatures weaker. Beware, for what you reap so may you sew, for the owner can choose to Conjure the creature in their turn and send it right back at you! 
EVERYTHING PLEDGE: For those that have missed the chance to back Ember so far, here's the Everything Pledge. This is for The Core Game, From the Ashes, and BOTH Light and Dark Packs. You're getting almost 200 super high quality cards for just £32 - that's a bargain!
If you want ALL the cards ever produced, there's a Kitchen Sink Pledge, which includes every promo card we ever made, along with every expansion and starter set! Bonus!
So, if you were ever on the fence about Ember, there has never been a better time to stick your wand in and pick up a copy!
Venture ever deeper into the dungeon to unlock our exciting Stretch Goals.
The Conjuring Cards are a selection of high quality postcard-sized sheets which list all the Conjuring Costs for all the creatures in the game - utterly invaluable when you're playing Ember.
All backers will get the above 2017 promo cards with any pledge level. That's already 24 cards for the price of 20! PLUS...
All backers will also get 5 mini postcard Conjuring Cost crib sheets - far more invaluable than you could possibly imagine right now!
And, if that wasn't enough, all backers currently get FIVE "Darke" mini-expansion cards. Five cards and counting...
Ember is a fast-paced fantasy game with elements of creature collection and take that! It's a game of strategy, of acting and reacting to the creatures your enemies' Conjure. 
During Ember’s hundreds of playtests, the playtesters consistently said they most enjoyed:    
That Ember is an intro game that can be learned by all ages in just a few minutes.  
Multiple ways to play: Ember has a variety of different ways to play based on your play-style. Casual Play, Hardcore, or even Battle Mode. 
A simple, yet surprisingly strategic game.  
The beautiful and highly evocative art.  
That you can mix and match cards to suit your strategy (don’t want an end game? Fine, just take out those cards. Hate the Take That element? No problem, just remove those cards, too. Ember is designed to be enjoyed in multiple ways with a variety of different rules to appeal to every gamer type. 
The often tense and tactical endgame (where anything can change).
Fantastic Quality. Check the reviews - everyone's impressed! You can't get better quality cards and it really does show! Printed by one of the world's top manufacturers, these 310g black core card stock cards are of sensational quality
Seal of Approval: Over the Saturday and Sunday of UK Games Expo 2016, almost 97% of participants who played a demo game of Ember went on to purchase a copy - that speaks volumes about the quality and how much fun Ember is!
The Game has Changed! With new rules, Ember is forever transformed from a game of simple creature conjuring into an action packed arena where every choice you make can affect the game play and result in blazing victory or crushing defeat. We're not joking, version 1.6 of the rules sees massive changes to the way the game plays... but don't worry, it's still fully compatible with the core game, or you can just play with the old rules - the choice is completely yours!
Play Light and Dark any way you like! It's a completely customizable game with as many house rules as you care to dream up!
The Prismatic Pack contains the cards of light, the healers and protectors of the Emberverse. The cards are all designed to protect play, to mitigate card effects and card loss. All the standard cards have two powers - a first in the Ember universe.
Three of the Prismatic cards provide 0 VP (Victory Points) on their own, but their VP are instead dependent on the cards you have in play.
Then you have Iridia, the Elemental Prismatic Dragon, whose powers focus on protection, of increasing your powers, and defending your forces against the powers of the Spectral.
Each Elemental Dragon has an legendary power which can be used if you control all three parts of that dragon, in this case, Irridia's ability allows you to give a creature you control +1 VP whenever any other player modifies a creature with a +1 VP or -1VP token. Powerful!
The Spectral cards are the powers of evil, of darkness and malevolence. These ten cards will give you the power to strip your opponents of their abilities, to force players to discard valuable cards, and to reduce the VP of their own creatures.
And then you have Sinistra, the Elemental Dragon God of Shadow. Her trio of powers are alone formidable, but when combined, she can affect all opponents with her powers every turn. Now that's nasty!
Sinistra is definitely a game changer... 
Check out the brand new review of Ember: Light and Dark from the Australian BoardGame Network by clicking here or on the image below.
ALSO, check out these reviews of the OLD version 1.5 rules, which are completely suitable for younger children and have very simple and easy to follow rules. These are not reviews of From the Ashes or Light and Dark (which sees a lot more complex mechanics).
Brewtube plays Ember...
 The amazing people are Gaming Knights... (love them).
 Toucan Play that Game - with Michael May...
 Board Gaming at Home...
If that's not enough, check back tonight for a live play-through of Ember: Light and Dark on Tabletop Simulator... 
Here's a 5 minute run through of how to play Ember: the Magical Card game. You can get a strong feel for how it plays (minus the brand new and super exciting new rules elements which make for a much tenser and exciting finish).
You can support us primarily by backing this campaign! Alternatively: 
Add a second copy to your pledge for your most magically-inclined friend. 
Tell your friends about the game via Facebook and Twitter, or via good, old-fashioned verbal communication (we would also suggest telepathy but we know only a few of you took Madame Tremolet's Psychic Classes!). 
Send us your thoughts and feedback in the project's comments section. Or simply show your interest in the game by following District 31 on Twitter, liking it on Facebook, or becoming a fan on BoardGameGeek. 
Long-time publishers with decades of experience: we released and delivered Ember: the Magical Card Game to customers within just 13 weeks (and one day) from the end of the campaign – that has got to be a record. 
All the proceeds from this Kickstarter is going toward our next game, which is scheduled for release at UK Games Expo 2017. Your support is invaluable in reaching our goals. So thanks for getting this far.
We place an emphasis on quality over everything else with superlative art and fun games.

campaign.story:
Sub Terra is a fully cooperative survival horror board game. You and up to five friends are cave explorers who have become trapped deep underground. You must quickly explore a tile-based cave system, utilise your character's specialist skills and carefully manage your actions to find the way out before your flashlights die and you're lost in the darkness forever.  
You'll need to work together to overcome deadly subterranean hazards - stick together for safety, or split up to cover more ground. One wrong step could knock you unconscious and your friends will need to stage a rescue. Light and hope are scarce. And worst of all, you don't think you're alone down here...
 Looking for the Stretch Goal announcements?
  Let's descend...
        Check out the how to play video below (courtesy of Toucan Play that Game), which outlines the game setting, objectives, gameplay and some strategies for attempting your escape!
Sub Terra is a team-based push-your-luck game. Together, you'll decide what risks are worth taking and when. The caves is a dangerous place - no matter how well you plan, things WILL go wrong, and your survival depends on how well you react to unforeseen circumstances.

YOUR OBJECTIVE: Escape the cave before you run out of time.
1) CAVERS: Everyone picks a caver, and gives that caver 3 health points. There are eight characters to choose from in Sub Terra - each has unique abilities that change how they play
2) TILES: Cavers begin the game on the START TILE. You're all trying to get to the EXIT TILE, which is near the bottom of the TILE STACK.
3) ACTIONS: Every round, each caver has two action points to spend (and can risk a health point for a third) 
The basic actions are: 
Reveal (Flip the top tile of the stack and place it a gap next to your current location) 
Move (Move to an adjacent connected tile) 
Explore (Reveal a tile, then immediately Move onto it. Faster, but riskier!) 
Heal (You or another caver on your tile regains one health point)
Run (Move three times) 
Together, you must place tiles as quickly as possible while not getting too spread out. Why not run off by yourself? Well…
4) HAZARDS: At the end of each round, resolve the top card of the HAZARD DECK. Each affects a certain type of tile: cavers on those tiles will lose health, and the tile may become harder to traverse. For example, GAS hurts cavers on GAS TILES a medium amount, whereas a FLOOD hurts those on WATER TILES only a little but makes the tile twice as costly to enter in the future.
 If you lose all your health points, you fall UNCONSCIOUS - you're unable to take further actions until another caver reaches your tile and HEALS you. If a friend is nearby, this won't take long. If you've strayed too far down a side passage, it might take some time to reach you. Why does that matter? Well…
5) RUNNING OUT OF TIME: When the hazard deck runs out of cards, your flashlights are nearly out of power: instead of resolving a card, each caver has a chance of getting lost in the darkness forever. Turns are precious - time spent rescuing fallen cavers or backtracking through difficult passages is time you'd rather spend uncovering more tiles and getting closer to the exit.
6) HORRORS: You're not alone down here. Some hazard cards can spawn...things...which will relentlessly hunt you down. If they catch you, you'll immediately lose all health points and fall unconscious. If you try to fight them, you will die. RUN.
7) MORE STUFF: Sub Terra also contains: cave-ins, squeezes, ledges, slides, ropes, rough treacherous terrain, tremors, dynamite, cave diving, "geology" and soul-crushing despair 
(soul-crushing despair supplied separately)
Eager to play Sub Terra? Check out all the cool downloadables and interactive Sub Terra content so you can see for yourself how the game works, and feels.

I.e. if you want add-ons that total £20, add £20 to the amount of your base pledge!

If you want to include add-ons when you first make your pledge, then simply manually edit the amount shown when you make the pledge to increase the number to include your add-ons. 
                     Making games can be pretty expensive, but the more we make, each one gets cheaper to produce. Instead of pocketing the extra cash, we, like many other Kickstarter creators, invest that value back into the project to make everyone's games better, bigger, and more terrifying!

  We've got a great shipping system set up ready for Sub Terra backers, utilising a combination of Chinese, Hong Kong and British freight handling and shipping agents, meaning that we can offer really competitive rates to EVERYONE, not just the UK and US.

We're offering EU, US, Canadian, and Australian friendly shipping, meaning no customs duties or taxes to deal with when your game arrives. We handle all that for you, and as it costs us less that way - we can offer even better rates to you!

Approximately 95% of the graphic design and illustration work is completed, with any additional work to be completed during the campaign or by two weeks from the end of the campaign. The team is poised!

MANUFACTURE:
We're partnering with Whatz games from Shanghai, the team behind Iello's manufacturing, they're fast, reliable and produce high quality games. We're confident they'll produce a box that helps us deliver the Sub Terra experience. I will personally review the blank samples, the pre-production samples, and if the budget permits, visit the factory itself to inspect the production run.

FREIGHT & SHIPPING:
We're working with a specially honed team of fulfillment and shipping experts, in Hong Kong, Shanghai, the UK and elsewhere to ensure that we can offer leading backer shipping rates as well as deliver you your games speedily and in good condition. We're aiming to get a chunk of games once manufactured to the UK Games Expo in June, so we're aiming to get shipping on the go before then. November is our worst case scenario. We may obviously sell copies of the game at the UKGE before some backers get their copy elsewhere in the world. We're hoping that this doesn't happen but we want to be upfront, we can't afford as a small publisher to not take that opportunity.

HORRORS:
There's a small chance the darkness will close in on the ITB team and the horrors will catch up to us. If this happens, we may not be able to ship your game, as we'll probably have been eaten. But don't worry because we've got he 'Experienced' ability and we've got a +1 to our skill check rolls.

campaign.story:
Miss Allison and Lord Brett flee from the burly Behemoth!
Blimey! You and your blokes have been banished and stripped of everything but a few shillings and table scraps. Undaunted, you journey to a strange land to reinvent yourself and reclaim your honor! Will you farm the earth, fight as knights or finagle your own feudums? Your fate is in your hands. (And for better or worse, the hands of a steely-eyed monarch named Queen Anne).
Hailed as "articulate and inventive," Feudum is a deeply nuanced game for 2-5 players that rewards resource management and skillful planning. Six uniquely powered characters and multiple paths to victory make for an ever-changing, open-world experience each time you play!
Feudum mechanics include action programming, area influence, hand management and a unique economic ecosystem. The game features the kinds of strategic complexities found in deeper games such as Terra Mystica, Brass, Caylus and Dominant Species. Jamey Stegmaier (designer of Scythe) compared the game in "depth and aesthetics to Trickerion,” while Jeremy and David of Man Vs Meeple likened it to Vinhos, the Gallerist and Madeira saying, there's a lot of thinking but "in the most fun way possible!"
With many strategies at their disposal, players optimize four actions per turn in an attempt to score the most veneration points over five epochs. Each player controls several medieval characters that roam the countryside tending farms, taxing towns and taking outposts in an effort to rise in power.
But, that’s only the tip of the behemoth's horn! You will also compete to acquire coveted feudums, which increase your membership status in one of six guilds. But beware! Feudum owners must pay homage to the king through military service, or face the charge of disloyalty. Long live the King!

Justin Schultz & Mark Swanson
Game Designer
Professor by day and game designer by night, I live in Columbia, Missouri with my three splendid daughters. I was Inspired by Eurostyle games in the late 90s and became a fan of legends like Reiner Knizia, Klaus Teuber, Martin Wallace and Andreas Seyfarth. I unveiled my prototype of Feudum at GenCon 2014 and was thrilled to meet and gain insight from folks like Eric Lang, Mike Eliott, Bruno Faidutti and Jamey Stegmaier. I am excited that the game has been hailed as "articulate and inventive," and appears on several "watch" lists within the BoardGameGeek community. I sincerely hope the kickstarter community feels the same way. Check out facebook.com/feudum or BoardGameGeek to learn more.
Artist
As he likes to put it, Justin Schultz is an "earthling living in Jackson, Mississippi." Justin studied graphic design at Mississippi State University and worked for a number of advertising agencies before focusing on concert posters, album covers, package design and, just recently, board game art! His distinctive style of populating his art with monsters, reptiles and robots conjures up memories of children's picture books, albeit slightly skewed. Justin explains that he likes to lure viewers in with "superficially charming images," but then reveal something more "heartbreaking" or "daunting" upon closer inspection.  In 2010, Justin started his independent studio, The Flying Chair
Odd Bird Games is excited to announce a partnership with Quartermaster Logistics to get you your rewards! They are powered by CoolStuffInc.com, a business that has been shipping games for over 14 years to customers around the world. Quartermaster Logistics will ensure your packages arrive safe and on time as every game is professionally packed and protected. 
How it Works
A short time after the campaign is over, you will receive an email from Backerkit that directs you to a pledge manager where you can confirm or upgrade your pledge, and add base games, expansions or other “add-ons.” (PayPal accepted). Shipping will be calculated at that time. Backerkit turns overpledges into a credit that may be used as you see fit in the pledge manager.   
Shipping Estimates
The rates below are good faith estimates and reflect actual current carrier rates (FedEx, UPS) plus freight. QM Logistics will be shipping from their international fulfillment centers local to backers so that backers avoid VAT. 
Add-On | 1 Game | 1 Game + 3 Exp | 3 Games | 6 Games
.01 kgs | 3.1 kgs | 5.43 Kgs | 9.3 kgs | 18.6 kgs   
$05 | $15 | $21 | $26 | $40 —United States
$10 | $15 | $22 | $30 | $40 —Canada
$10 | $18 | $19 | $21 | $23 —European Union
$10 | $20 | $22 | $26 | $35 —Australia

$10 | $50 | $?? | $?? | $?? —Rest of World   

Lighter-weight add-ons (everything except additional games or expansions) will not likely incur additional shipping costs. Space permitting, orders will be included in one box to reduce overall shipping costs. These rates are based on current carrier rates (FedEx, UPS) and may fluctuate.  

Rest of the World Fulfillment
QM logistics is dedicated to finding the most cost-effective delivery solution for backers around the world, therefore, the “Rest of World” rate is merely an averaged estimate. When possible, QM Logistics will use the fulfillment centers that are closest to backers in order to save them money. (For example, fulfilling from China, for East Asia, or fulfilling others from the EU shipping.) Be forewarned, it may be difficult to economically ship to some places in the world, but we will do our best.  

Bulk Shipping
Heavier rates will generally just be a multiple or combination of 50lb and under rates. So, shipping 5 Feudum Cartons  (3 games per carton) at 46.5 kgs, would probably travel in 1 30kg and 1 20kg package in Europe, or possibly travel in 5 separate 10 kg packages. It would depend on how the packing works out. Often these shipments will be broken up in multiple boxes that are all shipped at once.

Pallet Shipping
Once we reach a pallet sized shipment, (i.e. 99+ games), costs almost entirely depend on where it will be shipped. For example, shipping a single pallet can range from $150 - $700 in the U.S.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Truth be told, there will undoubtedly be a smattering of bumps, hiccups and faux pas made on this maiden voyage of ours. It is, after all, the first game that Justin and I have created. Deftly navigating the rough waters of fulfillment houses, freight shippers, manufacturers and backer relations won't be easy. 

Our naiveté is bound to try someone's patience at some point in this adventure. That said, my artist and I are indubitably marked by an old-fashioned, yet noble code of conduct: We always try to do the right thing. 

Of course, to do the right thing, one must have knowledge. Thanks to a treasure trove of books, online resources and the generous support of the game designer community, we both feel quite prepared to take on this challenge. 

Additionally, we have invested time and money in key partnerships that will streamline all operations. Backerkit will facilitate backer orders; OTX will ensure that freight shipping goes off without a hitch; Fulfillment houses like Fulfillrite, Spiral Galaxy, Starlit, Aetherworks and SFC will allow games to ship from within backers' countries of origin. 

So far, these partnerships have been marked by transparency and free-flowing communication, right down to the way cardboard boxes and bubble wrap will be used to ensure the safe transport of every game. 

At first, Odd Bird Games was like a methane gas-sniffing canary trapped deep within the bowels of a coal mine. But, by good fortune, we escaped up the shaft towards the light. And now, with your help....we will fiercely flutter toward the heavens.

Kingdom Death: Monster 1.5
Kingdom Death Monster is an massive cooperative board game about survival in a nightmare-horror world. Survivors fight for their lives against an onslaught of bizarre and fearsome creatures. They will use the fruits of these battles to build a fragile civilization in a place where humans are at the bottom of a monstrous ecology. 
Initially, I brought the concept for Monster to Kickstarter in order to make a far-away dream into a reality. The runaway train of success helped pack the game with more original art, in-depth gameplay, and fantastically sculpted minis than even I dreamed of. A game this size could not feasibly be made without the community of supportive backers we found on Kickstarter. It's too expensive to produce and too vivid for distribution.
Through the experience of kickstarting Monster, I found a group of people that shares my vision for a blisteringly difficult game with a continually emerging story. I am truly humbled to share it with the world.
Now there isn't a single factory sealed copy at KD HQ. There are still people asking if there will ever be more so I'm back on Kickstarter to launch a campaign for a new edition. I want to print updated rules, great new expansions, even more content and (with your help) many surprises!!!
Kingdom Death: Monster 1.5 Changelog

Gambler's Rolls
                                                                                                                                                                                                     First Hero Expansion
In the First Hero Expansion, players take the role of 4 veteran survivors who have no settlement to call their own. They find and invade a settlement where they face the First Hero, a survivor so powerful, they do all the hunting by themselves! The purpose of this expansion is to help players start more advanced campaigns at Lantern Year 12 or 20. Instead of simply providing complicated rules to generate later settlements, your showdown with the First Hero will create the advanced settlement that you can take over.

Shipping Details & Shipping Waves
One thing we've learned from managing the impossibly huge number of reward combinations from our first campaign is to strike a balance between timely delivery of rewards to our eager fans and being logistically responsible to our staff and partners. So here's what we've decided about shipping rewards for this campaign.

We have set the estimated delivery of all pledge levels to December 2020. This is a best case scenario, in case our campaign gets insanley huge! 3-4 years development, production & transportation cycle to 100% finish every promise we might make during this campaign is realistic.  
Rewards from this Kickstarter will ship in waves that will be determined by the final scope of this campaign. Each wave's shipping costs will be collected through a pledge manager (most likely backerkit) when the goods are ready to ship. Shipping costs will reflect the actual cost to ship your pledge and any additional rewards you selected from that wave.

Risks and challenges
I learned a lot about manufacturing a top-quality boutique game and fulfilling it to our backers from our first Kickstarter. Not all my lessons were easy, but all of them were meaningful. Trying to bring such a staggeringly large game to life, we worked insane hours, fought lots of battles, and saw some unexpected setbacks. It's taught me how to look for ways to turn logistical, artistic, and fiscal difficulties into assets.


I'm heading into this campaign with my eyes open. If this campaign meets with success we'll be on the hook to you guys for loads more quality content. The bigger we get, the more complex fulfillment will become. I will create a transparent, streamlined campaign from the outset and work hard to maintain the honest communication about our process and developments to make sure we meet everyone's expectations. We'll be pushing even harder to bring you the best of our vision without compromise.

campaign.story:
Introducing Mined Out, a pocket-sized game of far deeper proportions that throws players right into a dark and treacherous mine in search of precious gems.
With colourful illustration, arcade-inspired mechanics and fast-paced gameplay, it's a game that can entertain families and satisfy players of any level.
And, at the same size of games like Love Letter or Tiny Epic Galaxies, Mined Out is small enough to take anywhere, and deep enough to keep even the most strategy-obsessed players busy.
In Mined Out, players explore their own personal mines, displayed over a set of 12 different square cards, with billions of potential combinations guaranteeing a unique mine every time you play.
Players allocate limited Action Points to moving around their mine, collecting gems, building useful upgrades, securing hazardous areas of the mine, and sabotaging others with dynamite!
Once one player has built all of their upgrades, the player with the highest scoring combination of gems, upgrades and explored mine cards wins!
For the full rule set in English, click here: Mined Out! Rules
Or, watch this handy gameplay video:
    In each copy of Mined Out! you will get all of the below, plus any unlocked Stretch Goals!
    See what people are saying about Mined Out - click the banners below to see the full reviews!
Click the image for the full video review!
  Click the image for the full video review!
  Click the image for the full video review!
  When we reach each goal, we'll include the reward with all copies of the game - yes, every copy!
   Having run our previous campaign for Downsize earlier this year, we were keen to find out what backers of that campaign thought of our performance - and we were pleasantly surprised by their response!
  And I was in my final year of university at the time!
Not to forget, the component quality was pretty good too - and we're using the same manufacturer this time! Check out this unboxing video of Downsize!
With the exception of the rules, Mined Out is entirely language independent, making it easy to learn with the use of alternative language PDFs.
In addition, Mined Out is colourblind friendly, with different-shaped gems and high contrast illustrations ensuring that anyone can play.
And, with light-to-medium rules and no adult themes, Mined Out is also great for families with junior-gamers.
With the benefit of hindsight from our previous campaign for Downsize we’ve been able to fine-tune a manufacturing and fulfilment plan that will jump into action as soon as Mined Out is funded.
Playtesting Mined Out!
The manufacturing files are completed and ready to go, and our fulfilment team is on standby to deliver your games quickly and without the threat of pesky customs charges.
We hope that you put your trust in us a second time around to help make Mined Out into the success that it's waiting to be!
Thank You!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
On our last project, we had a few small problems, but got past them quickly, and successfully delivered on the project. Here is what we've done this time around to ensure that things go even smoother:

- Having gone through it once already and found people that we work well with and trust, we've been able to create a much more thorough plan for manufacturing and fulfilment, with realistic projections and a better understanding of the processes involved.

- We've got the manufacturing specifications and templates out of the way this time, rather than waiting until once the project is finished to see what we have to precisely do to get the game made.

- On our last project, the vast majority of backers got their games without customs charges. The exception to this rule was Denmark, and so this time we have adopted a different tactic for this region to ensure that absolutely nobody gets customs charges.

Campaign complete! Leaders of Euphoria: Choose a Better Oppressor has been successfully funded! Thanks to everyone who supported us to make this game a reality. If you missed out, you can pre-order it now at overworldgames.com!
Leaders of Euphoria is a dystopian game of strategic deduction. Based in the world of Euphoria by Stonemaier Games and built on the proven gameplay of our own Good Cop Bad Cop, players secretly join sides as they fight for control of the newly-founded city of Euphoria.
Find your allies, expose the enemy team's leader, and eliminate them to win the game! But don't shoot the wrong person, or they will join a new third faction - and target either leader for the win!
Built on Good Cop Bad Cop's proven gameplay, with strategic improvements: We took our acclaimed game Good Cop Bad Cop and rebuilt it from the ground up, removed player elimination (eliminated players now form a new third team!) and added more strategic choices and control to create a "gamer's" social deduction game.
Partnership with Stonemaier Games: We've partnered with Jamey Stegmaier of Stonemaier Games (Scythe, Viticulture, Euphoria) to set this game in the Euphoria universe.
AWESOME components: The best components we've ever made (OVERSIZED RAY GUN MINIS!) deliver the most immersive experience possible.
                Hundreds of playtesters helped perfect the design and development of Leaders of Euphoria. You can view the complete rulebook here or read on for an overview of the gameplay. We also have fan-translated versions of the rules in Spanish and Japanese.
          If you'd like, you can also watch The Board Game Network play out a full game!

The print files are ready to go so that once the campaign ends, we can send the print files to the printer and start the manufacturing process.

We recently announced we are changing our company name so we will no longer be known as Overworld Games, but instead we will be PULL THE PIN GAMES. Each game we make from now on will come in a small, $20 USD package where you'll literally pull a "pin" to open each box. Future games will be very easy to learn and support a lot of players so everything about them will make them easy to get it to the table. The first game with this box style is Good Cop Bad Cop 3rd Edition, coming out October 30th, which is the game on which Leaders of Euphoria was based.

updates.update_userinfo: Leaders Fulfilled, Gen Con, Retailer Splash, and Total Recall
updates.update_content: Well, we did it! You should have your copy of Leaders of Euphoria in your hands by now unless there was a special circumstance of some kind. If you don't, please let us know -- you can email support@overworldgames.com or send us a message.

How are those ray guns firing, Euphorians? Does anyone have home remedies for laser burn? We’ve got a quick update here and then you can get back to your interrogations.
All Games Shipped
For starters, all games have shipped as of last week so if you don't have yours, you will very soon. If anyone doesn’t have theirs by July 7th, send us a Kickstarter message or email so we can investigate.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update and a Box Tip
updates.update_content:
Psst... Euphorians... Subterrans... there's something around the corner over there...
No, it's not a Wastelander... it's your SHIPMENT! All regions are either delivered or will begin delivering next week! We’ve been keeping you updated in the comments day by day, but this is a good time for a proper update.
Delivery Windows

Friends! It's almost time to choose the new Leader of Euphoria! You better start digging for artifacts and dusting off your ray guns because the first deliveries are beginning this week. Many regions still have a little while to wait, so to help pass the time, you can learn the rules by checking out the How to Play video by Watch it Played below.

We're going to give some delivery estimates here, but most games haven't cleared customs yet and, if our customs officials don't play board games, it's possible they will see the cargo not as games, but as THOUSANDS OF BOXES OF GUNS. updates.update_userinfo: Freight Shipping Update and Barker's Row
updates.update_content:
Greetings Subterrans, Euphorians, and Wastelanders!
Today we go through our fulfillment partners for Leaders of Euphoria, we give you an update on freight shipping, plus we launched a new Kickstarter campaign today for Barker’s Row in case you want to join us for that one too!
Barker’s Row Launches

Hurrah! Our games are born! They exist! There is just some space in between us and them. It's like our arms are stretched out trying to grab them but they're just out of reach. Let's fix that, shall we? On Monday, the shipping to our fulfillment centers will begin, so we can all take comfort in the fact that the games will be physically moving closer to us with each passing day. In fact, when you wake up each morning, you can say, "Ahhh, I can feel it. Leaders of Euphoria is closer to me now."
And now it's REALLY time to lock down addresses so please make sure your address matches where you will be living between and . If you will be moving during that time or you have any other questions, please send us a message here or an email to support@overworldgames.com. You have about 48 hours from now to update your address through Kickstarter, which you can do by following these steps:

Good news, Euphorians! The Mass Production Copies (MPCs) are in our hands! These are the first copies off the production line and exactly what you can expect to receive. It’s a final check for us before our manufacturer puts the components in game boxes, shrink wraps them, and then puts the game boxes in shipping cartons in what is known as the “assembly” phase. This is our absolute last chance to make a change before they leave the plant, but fear not, everything looks perfect!
Here are some MPC pictures for your eyeballs to salivate over:

Oh that subject line was hard to write, but yes, a delay with the ray gun production has cropped up since our last update. The good news is that the Standard version of the game is wrapping up manufacturing this week (woo hoo!), but the bad news is that churning out ~8,000 ray guns for the Deluxe copies is going to take longer than expected.
This pushes our whole schedule back, meaning we won’t be able to start local shipping at the beginning of May as we communicated in the last update. :( That’s why we haven’t locked down addresses yet -- but we’ll still do that very soon so don’t go changing your address to something crazy! :)

campaign.story:
From the Ashes is the expansion to Ember: the Magical Card Game, and sees a host of new additions, including new creatures, brand new Tutors, magical artifacts, and the powerful elemental god cards. From the Ashes focuses on the endgame and player interaction to supercharge Ember into a tense and exciting game of creature conjuring. 
What you get: 56 cards in super high quality 310g black core card. And we're not done - yet - there's a colour profusion with the FINAL STRETCH GOALS...
Designed by Stuart Garside and with art by Sebastian Gosko, Ember is a game where you draw cards to form hands which you then discard to Conjure magical creatures, each with a unique magical ability that will give you an edge over your opponents. 
Ember is a game for everyone; beloved by children, the bright colours and simple rules make it the perfect gateway card game for gamers of all ages! You can learn how to play Ember in three minutes, but finding your favourite strategy might take a little while longer...
Back today and get a super limited Promo Card, Golden Star.
UPDATE: AROUND 35 promo cards left.
56 brand new UNIQUE cards make up From the Ashes, consisting of 27 new separate creatures, 12 x Elemental God cards, 7 x Tutor cards, 5 x Artifact cards, and 3 x Spectral creature cards, and 2 Promo  Cards: Prismatic Unicorn and Blood Dragon, all in a gorgeous Poker-sized tuckbox - and we're not nearly finished yet. With your support, we have major plans to supercharge this expansion…
Note: to add the 2016 promo cards to any pledge level that doesn't contain them - just add £5.00! You can do this at any time.
Fantastic Quality. Check the reviews - everyone's impressed! You can't get better quality cards and it really does show! Printed by one of the world's top manufacturers, these 310g black core card stock cards are of sensational quality.
Ember is a fast-paced fantasy filler game with elements of creature collection and take that! It hides a deceptively strategic depth under its gorgeous art and simple gameplay. It's a game of strategy, of acting and reacting to the creatures your enemies' Conjure; it's a game of memory, of face up and face down cards, and trying to keep a track of which player controls which cards as you prepare for the final endgame. While it has a luck of the draw factor, the variations of card effect mean it is always possible to turn things around and there are many many routes to victory. Ember has many different variations of play available which will suit almost all play styles. 
District 31: With over 20 years' experience in publishing - and having released one of the fastest fulfilled campaigns in Kickstarter history earlier this year (13 weeks from campaign end to shipping) - we wanted to bring you the complete Ember, giving you even more variety and more ways to win with From the Ashes. 
The new creature cards focus on Ember's endgame, on new strategies, and lower VP creatures.
During Ember’s hundreds of playtests, the playtesters consistently said they most enjoyed: 
That Ember is an intro game that can be learned by all ages in just a few minutes. 
Multiple ways to play: Ember has a variety of different ways to play based on your play-style. Casual Play, Hardcore, or even Battle Mode. 
A simple, yet surprisingly strategic game. 
The beautiful and highly evocative art. 
That you can mix and match cards to suit your strategy (don’t want an end game? Fine, just take out those cards. Hate the Take That element? No problem, just remove those cards, too. Ember is designed to be enjoyed in multiple ways with a variety of different rules to appeal to every gamer type. 
The often tense and tactical endgame (where anything can change). 
Seal of Approval: Over the Saturday and Sunday of UK Games Expo 2016, almost 97% of participants who played a demo game of Ember went on to purchase a copy - that speaks volumes about the quality and how much fun Ember is - and From the Ashes looks even better!  
Nearly half the new cards in From the Ashes are made up of new card types. 
Elemental Dragon Gods: the ancient elemental gods are beings of great power. Made up of Bahamut (the god of fire) and Kraken (the god of water) and Tarrasque (the god of earth). They are dragons made up of three separate parts. Collect all three (before your opponents) and gain a Legendary ability which will allow you to crush your enemies.
And the mysterious Kraken, which has powers to revitalise other creatures as well as being able to strip creatures of their abilities. 
Tarrasque has great powers to crush your enemies.
Tutors: are the teachers tutors at Alastor's Academy who wield great power. Each Tutor has a unique power that can influence the game to your advantage, along with a Quest that gives you crucial endgame bonuses.
Artifacts: are magical items of great power that are the first cards in the game with two or more abilities. The basic abilities of an artifact will help you on a turn-by-turn basis, and the secondary effect comes into play when you Conjure a VP 5 or higher creature, but if you need a boost of power, use their Arcane ability, but doing so will exhaust the item, flipping it in the process and losing all of its powers for the rest of the game.
All the finished cards will have a wide variety of unique backgrounds. Cards here are purely for illustration purposes only. 
Reprint of Wizard Cards: In addition to all of the above, every backer will also get the four x 6 cards which had a slight printing issue which meant some players struggled to tell which element they were. As you can see, there are no issues here.
We literally cannot improve upon the quality of the game components, so all our Stretch Goals are focused on bringing you new and exciting cards to add ever more value to the game.
Social Stretch Goals: Facebook 600 Likes - UNLOCKED
SOCIAL STRETCH GOAL #2: 700 Facebook Likes. 
And more to come!
Being a UK company we are determined to support our local industry, as a result we've got plenty of UK games reviews from some of the best reviewers around.
Board, Deck & Dice
Gaming Knights
Toucan Play That Game (they call it "a keeper").
Board Gaming At Home 
Also, check out our Ember BoardGameGeek page for all our great comments and feedback. 
Check out our 5 minute Instructional Video (incorporating the EndGame).
You can download the v1.4 rules here. And you can download the playtest version of the From the Ashes rules here.
Shipping is getting ever more expensive, but our agreements with Royal Mail give us the best prices to ship around the world.  
For each additional copy of From the Ashes, please add: UK: £2.00 Europe / USA: £3.00 Rest of World: £4.00
To add the 2016 promo cards to your order, just add £5.00 (there is no additional shipping involved). 
Alternatively, get in touch for a location-specific quote on multiple copies. 
You can primarily support us by backing the From the Ashes campaign! 
Add a second copy to your pledge for your most magically-inclined friend. 
Tell your friends about the game via Facebook and Twitter, or via good, old-fashioned verbal communication (we would also suggest telepathy but we know only a few of you took Madame Tremolet's Psychic Classes!). 
The more Likes we get, the more Promo Cards we’ll release. Bonus! 
Send us your thoughts and feedback in the project's comments section. 
Or simply show your interest in the game by following Ember on Twitter, liking it on Facebook, or becoming a fan on BoardGameGeek. 
Long-time publishers with decades of experience: we released and delivered Ember: the Magical Card Game to customers within just 13 weeks (and one day) from the end of the campaign – that has got to be a record. We place an emphasis on quality over everything else with superlative art and fun games. They may not be the most serious, but they are darn pretty to look at.
GET IN TOUCH. I'll be available all day on Live Chat on the Facebook page. If you have ANY questions, big or small, or even if you just want to say hello, then message me. 
Stu Garside
Sebastian Gosko
 That's it, there IS no more. Go away and pledge now. THANKS :)

campaign.story:
My project started about two years ago, when I was looking for a Super Market board game for all the family. I couldn't find one to suit my needs, so I decided to create my own. First, I did a basic design, just using cardboard and paper and tested the game with my family and friends. Second, I ordered my first official prototype and found out I needed to change a few things. Earlier this year, I ordered my second prototype, which I felt satisfied with. The prototypes game from thegamecrafter.com
Third, I took the prototype to UK Games Expo, where I had a stand and people could playtest the game. I had a few pre-orders and lots of positive comments. I didn't receive any negative comments. The next stage is to order my stock for my shop.This is where I need the money, as I would like to have 100 copies of the game in my shop. The money will be used for the manufacturing and shipping costs to build up my stock.
The object of the game is to be the first player to arrive back at their home after they have bought their shopping. At the beginning of the game, the players receive a Shopping List.

campaign.story:
Cosmic Balance is a hybrid board/card game of battling gods, angels, and demons for 2-5 players. It takes under an hour to play. Your cards become the fighting units that conquer and control territories. Since you're a god you decide whether to send defeated cards to the Heaven discard pile or the Hell discard pile! The discard piles sit on a scale that measures how many defeated enemies have been sent to Heaven or Hell. Tip the scales and open the gates of Hell or Heaven. You get Victory Points from each territory you control at the end of your turn plus bonus points from Angel and Demon cards. The player with the most Victory Points at the end wins!
If you like to eat dessert first you can just skip to the rule book here or check out the amazingly detailed gameboard here.
Lastly if funded, this will be our 4th published game!  Our previous game, Curses, won the Mensa Select award and our other game, Angel Quest - The Random Acts of Kindness Cards landed us on the Montel Williams Show as the "kindest family in America."  We can't wait to see where Cosmic Balance takes us!
Even Montel Williams likes the games we make!
  An amazingly illustrated board! Lars went a little nuts on this thing. This is one of the most detailed game boards we've ever seen. It's 31 inches by 20 inches. (78cm x 51cm) and fits perfectly in the game box.
Board Game Mock Up. Image Not Final.
An original concept! As far as we can tell, this is the first game ever to use a scale to track how many dead cards are in two discard piles. There's also a couple hundred cards, 60 resource counters, 28 battle tokens, and 50 influence tokens.
Game pieces not final.
 A Kickstarter Exclusive! 7 Knight cards, 5 Shield Tokens plus the God of Protection card available only to Kickstarter backers.  (See Update #5 for more details.)
The retail version will not include the God of Protection card, the 7 Knights cards, or their 5 Shield Tokens, and this Kickstarter campaign is the only place they will ever be available!
  We spent a year refining the design of the Cosmic Balance scale.
Check out a close up of the cards here!
Sample cards.
 Let the All Father enlighten you on the parts of the card...
  Check out the reviews below and also our interview with Druid City Games. You can also check out our Board Game Geek page!
Click here to read Geek Dad's game review!
                     All unlocked Stretch Goals are included in all shipped games!
You've unlocked killer bunnies & reapers!
 All unlocked Social Goals are included in all shipped games!
Social goals require no spending of your precious, wonderful money! Just share links and write posts on places like our page on Board Game Geek and we will bow to your very will.  
    FULL RULEBOOK HERE
On your turn you have three actions. Spend your actions to draw Mortal cards from your deck or play your Mortal cards from your hand on to any of the board's eight territories. At the end of your turn score one Victory Point for each territory your Mortals control plus bonus points from Angel and Demon cards. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins.
Cards, like the below Giant, destroy your enemies and keep control of your territories. You have to spend Good or Evil to play them from your hand. But where do you get this Good or Evil?
Your Peasant cards (seen above) generate Good for you when you send them to the nice parts of the board. Likewise, you earn Evil for sending the hapless Peasants to the icky nasty parts of the board, where there is only death and Brussels sprouts. Then you can spend this Good and Evil to play the more powerful mortal cards from your hand, such as Vampires, Knights, and aforementioned hangry Giants. 
There's also a game zone called The Beyond. Cards in The Beyond are face up and available for all players to purchase. You can summon powerful Angels and Demons from The Beyond when you save up enough Good or Evil, but they cost a lot more.
Whenever one of your cards kills an enemy on the board, you decide whether to send that enemy to Heaven or Hell, located on the Cosmic Balance scale.
Content images not final.
If more cards end up in Heaven, that side tips down, and the Gates of Heaven open. Whenever you open Heaven or Hell you get an additional action for that turn. If you are clever you can use this to re-balance and re-open the gates for even more actions.
While Heaven is open, all Angels in The Beyond cost half the normal amount of Good and you can summon them to defeat even more enemies and conquer more territories! Same with tipping down Hell and opening the way for Demons to stomp the faces of your enemies. Angels and Demons are freakin' powerful compared to the other units. They will often hit the board and kill something to help you tip the scales yet again. Angels and Demons also get you extra VP at the end of each of your turns.
Beyond Cards and God Powers
You'll have 2 different God Powers every game. At the beginning of the game, each player chooses 2 of the 15 God Power cards, such as Greed, Blood, Protection, or Wind. Each of these powers determines which factions will go in your deck, so there are countless combinations. (Well, 15 factions have 105 possible pairings, so we're just going to call that countless.) Each God Power card also has a unique base ability that you can combine and use throughout the game. Some examples:
Which two of these God Powers would you choose?
God of Hunger: Whenever you destroy a non-Peasant enemy, gain 1 extra victory. Start with the Wolves faction in your deck.
God of Prosperity: Draw an extra card on each of your turns. Start with the Merchants faction in your deck.
God of Wind: On each of your turns you may move any card to a different territory. Start with the Eagles faction in your deck.
As a god, you can hear all the secret thoughts and prayers of the mortal cards in your deck. Although it won't affect the game's outcome, you can have fun granting the prayers of your followers. Or you can crush them and send them to Hell! That's the great part about being a god. You get to judge mortals and they can't judge you!
We're Alexandra Tinsman and Brian Tinsman, the creators of Cosmic Balance. We've spent the past 20 years helping to craft legendary tabletop gaming experiences (including favorites such as Magic:The Gathering, Dungeons & Dragons, Duel Masters, Curses, Risk, and Pokémon) which has prepared us for the launch of this game. Lars Nielsen is the artist and Claudia Ng is the engineer.
Wonder powers unite! Form of Cosmic Balance team.
Alex has spent her career in marketing and product development for top game brands including: Riot Games (League of Legends), Microsoft (Xbox, Halo, Minecraft), Wizards of the Coast (Magic:The Gathering, Dungeons & Dragons), Pokémon, Hasbro (Star Wars, Avalon Hill), and Gen Con.  
Brian is an award-winning game designer with over 37 shipped game titles (including lead game design on 8 Magic:The Gathering sets, including Rise of the Eldrazi, Avacyn Restored, and Time Spiral.) He's also the author of The Game Inventor's Guidebook and has secured multiple new gameplay mechanic patents.  
Lars Nielsen is our lead artist. His unique art style has made him a favorite among gamers and indie comics fans. He's also the progeny of renowned Magic artist, Terese Nielsen, and has spent his life immersed in gaming culture. You may even recognize him from the Magic card, Samite Elder.  
Claudia Ng is the owner and creator of Succulent Monsters, the cutest 3D printed monster planters on the internets. She is also the engineer of the Cosmic Balance device. She invented the physical mechanism that allows us to adjust how many cards are needed to tip the balance.
With your support, this game will continue to grow as we develop new content over time. Like a good living card game, it's built to support an almost unlimited number of new factions and god powers. 
You can already customize your play experience by selecting a subset of Angels and Demons in The Beyond to provide a faster or slower game, and this will get better over time as we release more cards, god powers, and Angels/Demons.
With these new card releases we'll include some suggested faction combinations so you can maximize the influence of player skill or have a wacky, highly swingy game for your friends that enjoyed the Transformers movies - a lot of exciting action as long as you don't think too hard. 
  We continue to add new countries but for now we our shipping costs are:

Alex was brand manager for Magic: The Gathering and Brian was lead designer on 8 Magic expansion sets. Magic’s use of the graveyard as a semi-active game zone inspired the idea for a board game where players could use the discard pile to affect battles on the board and use the weight of dead cards to measure the carnage. After a lot of prototyping we developed the Cosmic Balance device. Watch the video to learn our prototype journey for the Cosmic Balance scale!
Check out how Claudia uses her 3D printer to make the prototypes for the Cosmic Balance scale! 
FUN FACT: Alex first met Lars in 2001 when he was 8 years old hanging out with his mom, Terese, at the Magic Pro Tour LA on the "haunted" Queen Mary boat/hotel.  They've been friends ever since.
Here's a behind-the-scenes sneak peek at the gameboard art concept. This board has an exceptionally high level of detailed illustration!
Concept art for Cosmic Balance gameboard (by Lars Nielsen).
  You can make this game even better by being part of our community and discussing the countless small decisions that go into making a strategy board game. What are the best cards? What's the funniest flavor text? How could the rule book be clearer? Are there card interactions not covered in the FAQ? Which card is most overpowered?
All this stuff is super important to making a high quality game that you'll be proud to have on your sacred gaming table.
Welcome to our tribe.
It's the end of the world but after-life party is jut beginning.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every board game carries risks in budgeting, manufacturing, quality control, packouts, and shipping on time. Though this is our first Kickstarter we've created dozens of published tabletop games so we understand these risks well.

The biggest risk in most Kickstarter board games is game play quality. How often will you want to play it again? We're highly focused on this issue and we will not release it until the gameplay passes the highest quality bar according to our panel of experienced designers.

This game has a simple base system with a lot of complex content that we'll need to carefully balance for strategic fairness and replayability. Almost all of our playtest criticism has centered on card and power balance, which we will continue to refine even after funding.

Though our theme is lighthearted, there's a powerful engine under the hood. When we worked on Magic: the Gathering expansions we did a great job of balance tuning (with a lot of help) and they turned out to be some of the best selling sets ever. Though this is much simpler than that game we are trying to achieve a similar quality result here. Our success or failure will mean the difference between good and great.

campaign.story:
The Queen is in a bad mood because her Realm is a total mess. Someone is going to pay - just make sure it isn't you!
In this fast-paced card game for 2 to 4 players you raise the issues that will earn the Queen's displeasure and then blame your friends for everything! Cold-blooded betrayal has never been so much fun!
We played over 100 games at UK Games Expo with overwhelmingly positive feedback. With the art and design complete, we need to raise £3000 to get Game of Blame professionally printed.
        Choose from one of six Roles. Advanced rules add unique abilities to further your ambitions.
  Each turn you raise Issues by playing up to 3 cards onto the Blame pile. Each Issue played must share at least one emblem with the card beneath it. The number of Issues you play triggers an event:
Play no issues, draw 3 cards
Play 1, draw 1 card
Play 2, swap 2 Roles
Play 3, accuse another player
If an Issue’s emblem matches your Role’s emblem – it is your responsibility.
When you accuse someone you both go through the Blame pile and count up your responsibilities. If the accused player has more, they take the Blame pile. Otherwise you must take the Blame!
After someone has taken the Blame, the other players may take advantage of the confusion by burying a secret. Take a card from your hand and hide it under your Role card.
Play then restarts with the blamed player turning over a card to start a new blame pile and then taking a normal turn.
The game ends immediately when the draw pile is empty. Everyone counts up the Issues in their hand that match their current Role and add 6 for each Treason card. The higher your score, the worse your punishment. But score zero and you may earn the Queen's favour.
Download a pdf of the rules here.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Game Salute has delivered dozens and dozens of successful Kickstarter campaigns, and is a publisher of games recognized for their high quality components and production values.

While printing, shipping, and processing delays are always a possibility, we have set a reasonable delivery date that allows time to handle difficulties. That said, there is always a possibility that a project may be delayed for some reason, and of course, vice versa, should the games arrive before the estimated delivery date, we will send them out as soon as we receive them.

We're so confident that you'll enjoy Planetarium that we're backing it up with our Game Salute Guarantee. If you don't enjoy the game when you receive it, just send either back to our headquarters and we'll issue you a full refund, no questions asked.

Also, sometimes people may want to cancel their pledge after the campaign has ended, and that’s fine too. We can handle this for you – all we need is for you to email Support@GameSalute.com with your Kickstarter username and full real name. Please note: when we receive your funds, we only receive around 90% of what you paid thanks to various fees and charges, so we offer a 90% refund if you want to cancel your pledge.

Thanks for supporting Planetarium! You're awesome!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
